Title:Microsoft Windows 11 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and the software is provided "AS IS" without warranty or guarantee of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to, the warranties of merchantability and of fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall the Government be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or other dealings in the software. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Front-Matter:This content stream was enhanced with OCIL manual questions derived from the STIG Manual by the NIWC SCC team.

Release Info:Enhanced Content 1.2.4 Date: 2023-08-08, based on Release: 1.2 Benchmark Date: 11 May 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-253263 - Windows 11 systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level. - Pass
    • V-253265 - Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS. - Fail
    • V-253275 - Internet Information System (IIS) or its subcomponents must not be installed on a workstation. - Pass
    • V-253283 - Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least OptOut. - Fail
    • V-253284 - Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be enabled. - Fail
    • V-253305 - Reversible password encryption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-253382 - Solicited Remote Assistance must not be allowed. - Fail
    • V-253386 - Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices. - Fail
    • V-253387 - The default autorun behavior must be configured to prevent autorun commands. - Fail
    • V-253388 - Autoplay must be disabled for all drives. - Fail
    • V-253411 - The Windows Installer feature "Always install with elevated privileges" must be disabled. - Fail
    • V-253416 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication. - Fail
    • V-253418 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication. - Fail
    • V-253452 - Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-253453 - Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-253454 - Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted. - Fail
    • V-253456 - Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted. - Pass
    • V-253461 - The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords. - Pass
    • V-253462 - The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM. - Fail
    • V-253481 - The "Act as part of the operating system" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253486 - The "Create a token object" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253490 - The "Debug programs" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-253264 - The Windows 11 system must use an antivirus program. - Not Checked
    • V-253269 - Only accounts responsible for the administration of a system must have Administrator rights on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-253294 - Administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email. - Not Checked
    • V-253370 - Credential Guard must be running on Windows 11 domain-joined systems. - Not Checked

    Automated Checks

    • V-253259 - Windows 11 information systems must use BitLocker to encrypt all disks to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest. - Fail

    • V-253261 - Windows 11 systems must use a BitLocker PIN with a minimum length of six digits for pre-boot authentication. - Fail
    • V-253276 - Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) must not be installed on the system. - Pass
    • V-253277 - Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed on the system. - Pass

    • V-253451 - The Windows SMB server must be configured to always perform SMB packet signing. - Fail

    • V-253457 - Remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) must be restricted to Administrators. - Fail
    • V-253458 - NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session. - Fail
    • V-253459 - PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented. - Fail

    • V-253464 - The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based clients. - Fail
    • V-253465 - The system must be configured to meet the minimum session security requirement for NTLM SSP based servers. - Fail
    • V-253466 - The system must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing. - Fail
    • V-253468 - User Account Control approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled. - Fail
    • V-253469 - User Account Control must prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop. - Fail
    • V-253471 - User Account Control must automatically deny elevation requests for standard users. - Fail

    • V-253473 - User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations. - Pass
    • V-253474 - User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC. - Pass
    • V-253475 - User Account Control must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations. - Pass
    • V-253478 - Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments. - Pass
    • V-253479 - The "Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253480 - The "Access this computer from the network" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators and Remote Desktop Users groups. - Fail
    • V-253482 - The "Allow log on locally" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators and Users groups. - Fail
    • V-253483 - The "Back up files and directories" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail

    • V-253485 - The "Create a pagefile" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253487 - The "Create global objects" user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-253488 - The "Create permanent shared objects" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253489 - The "Create symbolic links" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253491 - The "Deny access to this computer from the network" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-253494 - The "Deny log on locally" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-253495 - The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" user right on Windows 11 workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-253496 - The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253497 - The "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253498 - The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-253499 - The "Load and unload device drivers" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253500 - The "Lock pages in memory" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-253501 - The "Manage auditing and security log" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    • V-253503 - The "Perform volume maintenance tasks" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253504 - The "Profile single process" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-253505 - The "Restore files and directories" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail
    • V-253506 - The "Take ownership of files or other objects" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-256893 - Internet Explorer must be disabled for Windows 11. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-253255 - Windows 11 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled. - Not Checked
    • V-253256 - Windows 11 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS. - Not Checked
    • V-253257 - Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows 11 systems. - Not Checked
    • V-253258 - Windows 11 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where ESS is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP). - Not Checked
    • V-253262 - The operating system must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs. - Not Checked
    • V-253266 - Alternate operating systems must not be permitted on the same system. - Not Checked
    • V-253267 - Non-system-created file shares on a system must limit access to groups that require it. - Not Checked
    • V-253270 - Only accounts responsible for the backup operations must be members of the Backup Operators group. - Not Checked
    • V-253271 - Only authorized user accounts must be allowed to create or run virtual machines on Windows 11 systems. - Not Checked
    • V-253273 - Accounts must be configured to require password expiration. - Not Checked
    • V-253274 - Permissions for system files and directories must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-253280 - Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 11. - Not Checked
    • V-253281 - A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-253282 - Inbound exceptions to the firewall on Windows 11 domain workstations must only allow authorized remote management hosts. - Not Checked
    • V-253290 - Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 11. - Not Checked
    • V-253291 - Bluetooth must be turned off unless approved by the organization. - Not Checked
    • V-253292 - Bluetooth must be turned off when not in use. - Not Checked
    • V-253293 - The system must notify the user when a Bluetooth device attempts to connect. - Not Checked
    • V-253295 - Windows 11 nonpersistent VM sessions must not exceed 24 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-253323 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures. - Not Checked
    • V-253324 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes. - Not Checked
    • V-253350 - Camera access from the lock screen must be disabled. - Not Checked
    • V-253351 - Windows 11 must cover or disable the built-in or attached camera when not in use. - Not Checked
    • V-253363 - Windows 11 must be configured to prioritize ECC Curves with longer key lengths first. - Not Checked
    • V-253369 - Virtualization-based Security must be enabled on Windows 11 with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. - Not Checked
    • V-253371 - Virtualization-based protection of code integrity must be enabled. - Not Checked
    • V-253431 - Default permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE registry hive must be maintained. - Not Checked
    • V-253476 - Passwords for enabled local Administrator accounts must be changed at least every 60 days. - Not Checked

Results: Low Severity (CAT III)

    Automated Checks

    • V-253355 - The system must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) generated routes. - Fail
    • V-253356 - The system must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers. - Fail
    • V-253384 - The setting to allow Microsoft accounts to be optional for modern style apps must be enabled. - Fail
    • V-253385 - The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft. - Fail
    • V-253390 - Microsoft consumer experiences must be turned off. - Fail
    • V-253394 - Windows Update must not obtain updates from other PCs on the internet. - Fail
    • V-253397 - File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-253441 - The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset. - Pass
    • V-253442 - The maximum age for machine account passwords must be configured to 30 days or less. - Pass
    • V-253467 - The default permissions of global system objects must be increased. - Pass
    • V-253477 - Toast notifications to the lock screen must be turned off. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-253268 - Unused accounts must be disabled or removed from the system after 35 days of inactivity. - Not Checked
    • V-253272 - Standard local user accounts must not exist on a system in a domain. - Not Checked
    • V-253296 - The Windows 11 time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source. - Not Checked
    • V-253425 - Windows 11 must be configured to prevent users from receiving suggestions for third-party or additional applications. - Not Checked
    • V-253446 - The Windows message title for the legal notice must be configured. - Not Checked

Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    V-253263 - Windows 11 systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253263r828873_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000040
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Windows 11 is maintained by Microsoft at servicing levels for specific periods of time to support Windows as a Service. Systems at unsupported servicing levels or releases will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities which leaves them subject to exploitation.

    New versions with feature updates are planned to be released on a semi-annual basis with an estimated support timeframe of 18 to 30 months depending on the release. Support for previously released versions has been extended for Enterprise editions.

    A separate servicing branch intended for special purpose systems is the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC, formerly Branch - LTSB) which will receive security updates for 10 years but excludes feature updates.
    Fix Text:Update systems on the Semi-Annual Channel to "Microsoft Windows 11 Version 21H2 (OS Build 22000.348)" or greater.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253263
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-00-000040 - Windows 11 systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.
    Description:Windows 11 is maintained by Microsoft at servicing levels for specific periods of time to support Windows as a Service. Systems at unsupported servicing levels or releases will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities which leaves them subject to exploitation.

    New versions with feature updates are planned to be released on a semi-annual basis with an estimated support timeframe of 18 to 30 months depending on the release. Support for previously released versions has been extended for Enterprise editions.

    A separate servicing branch intended for special purpose systems is the Long-Term Servicing Channel (LTSC, formerly Branch - LTSB) which will receive security updates for 10 years but excludes feature updates.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (The OS Version is equal to or greater than 6.3)
        • true (The OS Build is equal to or greater than 22000)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326300 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The OS Version is equal to or greater than 6.3
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name must be equal to 'CurrentVersion'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25326300 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '6.3'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name equals 'CurrentVersion'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092850000000'
    • type equals 'reg_sz'
    • value equals '6.3'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326301 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The OS Build is equal to or greater than 22000
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326301 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name must be equal to 'CurrentBuildNumber'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25326301 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '22000'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name equals 'CurrentBuildNumber'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092850000000'
    • type equals 'reg_sz'
    • value equals '22621'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-253265 - Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253265r828879_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000050
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using the NTFS file system.
    Fix Text:Format all local volumes to use NTFS.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253265
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000050 - Local volumes must be formatted using NTFS.
    Description:The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using the NTFS file system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Local volumes use NTFS)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326500 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Local volumes use NTFS
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326500 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT deviceid FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!="NTFS"'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT deviceid FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!="NTFS"'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • deviceid = 'G:'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253275 - Internet Information System (IIS) or its subcomponents must not be installed on a workstation.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253275r828909_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000100
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: IIS is not installed by default. Installation of Internet Information System (IIS) may allow unauthorized internet services to be hosted. Websites must only be hosted on servers that have been designed for that purpose and can be adequately secured.

    V-253283 - Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least OptOut.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253283r828933_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000145
    Identities:CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-16)
    Description: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Data Execution Prevention (DEP) prevents harmful code from running in protected memory locations reserved for Windows and other programs.
    Fix Text:Configure DEP to at least OptOut.

    Note: Suspend BitLocker before making changes to the DEP configuration.

    Open a command prompt (cmd.exe) or PowerShell with elevated privileges (Run as administrator).
    Enter "BCDEDIT /set {current} nx OptOut". (If using PowerShell "{current}" must be enclosed in quotes.)
    "AlwaysOn", a more restrictive selection, is also valid but does not allow applications that do not function properly to be opted out of DEP.

    Opted out exceptions can be configured in the "System Properties".

    Open "System" in Control Panel.
    Select "Advanced system settings".
    Click "Settings" in the "Performance" section.
    Select the "Data Execution Prevention" tab.
    Applications that are opted out are configured in the window below the selection "Turn on DEP for all programs and services except those I select:".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253283
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000145 - Data Execution Prevention (DEP) must be configured to at least OptOut.
    Description:Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Data Execution Prevention (DEP) prevents harmful code from running in protected memory locations reserved for Windows and other programs.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Data Execution Prevention (DEP) is set to 'OptOut' or 'AlwaysOn')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328300 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Data Execution Prevention (DEP) is set to 'OptOut' or 'AlwaysOn'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328300 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328300 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328301 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy must be equal to '3'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy FROM win32_operatingsystem'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • dataexecutionprevention_supportpolicy = '2'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-253284 - Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253284r828936_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000150
    Identities:CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-16)
    Description: Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) blocks exploits that use the Structured Exception Handling overwrite technique, a common buffer overflow attack.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Enable Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP)" to "Enabled".

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253284
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000150 - Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) must be enabled.
    Description:Attackers are constantly looking for vulnerabilities in systems and applications. Structured Exception Handling Overwrite Protection (SEHOP) blocks exploits that use the Structured Exception Handling overwrite technique, a common buffer overflow attack.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (SEHOP is turned on and properly configured)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328400 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:SEHOP is turned on and properly configured
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\kernel'
    • name must be equal to 'DisableExceptionChainValidation'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253305 - Reversible password encryption must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253305r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AC-000045
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Store passwords using reversible encryption" to "Disabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253305
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AC-000045 - Reversible password encryption must be disabled.
    Description:Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330500 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330500 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', reversible_encryption must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-253382 - Solicited Remote Assistance must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253382r829230_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000155
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Remote assistance allows another user to view or take control of the local session of a user. Solicited assistance is help that is specifically requested by the local user. This may allow unauthorized parties access to the resources on the computer.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Remote Assistance >> "Configure Solicited Remote Assistance" to "Disabled".

    V-253386 - Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253386r829242_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000180
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable autoplay for non-volume devices (such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices).
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253386
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000180 - Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.
    Description:Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable autoplay for non-volume devices (such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices).
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25338600 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25338600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoAutoplayfornonVolume'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253387 - The default autorun behavior must be configured to prevent autorun commands.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253387r829245_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000185
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing autorun commands to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Configuring this setting prevents autorun commands from executing.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Set the default behavior for AutoRun" to "Enabled:Do not execute any autorun commands".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253387
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000185 - The default autorun behavior must be configured to prevent autorun commands.
    Description:Allowing autorun commands to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Configuring this setting prevents autorun commands from executing.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Default behavior for AutoRun' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Do not execute any autorun commands' selected)
    Tests:

    Result:false

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25338700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoAutorun'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253388 - Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253388r829248_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000190
    Identities:CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, autoplay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. If this policy is enabled, autoplay can be disabled on all drives.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Turn off AutoPlay" to "Enabled:All Drives".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253388
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000190 - Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.
    Description:Allowing autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted in the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, autoplay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. If this policy is enabled, autoplay can be disabled on all drives.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25338800 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled:All Drives'
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25338800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25338800 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '255'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253411 - The Windows Installer feature "Always install with elevated privileges" must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253411r829317_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000315
    Identities:CCI-001812 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-11 (2))
    Description: Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges. Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Installer >> "Always install with elevated privileges" to "Disabled".

    Weight:10.0

      • false (All child checks must be true.)

    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer'
    • name must be equal to 'AlwaysInstallElevated'

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

    V-253418 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253418r877395_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000345
    Identities:CCI-000877 (NIST SP 800-53: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53A: MA-4.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 c)
    Description: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Remote Management (WinRM) >> WinRM Service >> "Allow Basic authentication" to "Disabled".

    Severity Override Guidance: The AO can allow the severity override if they have reviewed the overall protection. This would only be allowed temporarily for implementation as documented and approved.
    ....
    Allowing Basic authentication to be used for the sole creation of Office 365 DoD tenants.
    ....
    A documented mechanism and or script that can disable Basic authentication once administration completes.
    ....
    Use of a Privileged Access Workstation (PAW) and adherence to the Clean Source principle for administration.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA

    V-253452 - Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253452r829440_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000140
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Allowing anonymous SID/Name translation can provide sensitive information for accessing a system. Only authorized users must be able to perform such translations.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation" to "Disabled".

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', anonymous_name_lookup must be equal to '0'

    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-253453 - Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253453r829443_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000145
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous log on users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253453
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000145 - Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.
    Description:Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous log on users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25345300 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25345300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092810000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-253454 - Anonymous enumeration of shares must be restricted.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253454r829446_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-SO-000150
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Allowing anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all account names and enumerate all shared resources can provide a map of potential points to attack the system.

    V-253456 - Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253456r829452_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000165
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253456
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000165 - Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.
    Description:Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares' is set to 'Enabled')

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'restrictnullsessaccess'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'

    V-253461 - The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253461r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000195
    Identities:CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords. This setting controls whether or not a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253461
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000195 - The system must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords.
    Description:The LAN Manager hash uses a weak encryption algorithm and there are several tools available that use this hash to retrieve account passwords. This setting controls whether or not a LAN Manager hash of the password is stored in the SAM the next time the password is changed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25346100 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Network security: Do not store LAN Manager hash value on next password change' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25346100 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'NoLMHash'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'NoLMHash'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092810000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-253462 - The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253462r829470_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-SO-000205
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The Kerberos v5 authentication protocol is the default for authentication of users who are logging on to domain accounts. NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it. It is also used to authenticate logons to stand-alone computers that are running later versions.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network security: LAN Manager authentication level" to "Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253462
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-SO-000205 - The LanMan authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only, and to refuse LM and NTLM.
    Description:The Kerberos v5 authentication protocol is the default for authentication of users who are logging on to domain accounts. NTLM, which is less secure, is retained in later Windows versions for compatibility with clients and servers that are running earlier versions of Windows or applications that still use it. It is also used to authenticate logons to stand-alone computers that are running later versions.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5))
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25346200 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Network security: LAN Manager authentication level' is set to 'Send NTLMv2 response only. Refuse LM & NTLM' (Level 5)
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25346200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'LmCompatibilityLevel'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25346200 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '5'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253481 - The "Act as part of the operating system" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253481r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000015
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Act as part of the operating system" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253481
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-UR-000015 - The "Act as part of the operating system" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Act as part of the operating system" user right can assume the identity of any user and gain access to resources that user is authorized to access. Any accounts with this right can take complete control of a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (No users have the privilege to act as part of the operating system.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25348100 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:No users have the privilege to act as part of the operating system.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000008 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '.+'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25348100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', setcbprivilege must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • setcbprivilege equals '1' for:
    • setcbprivilege equals '0' for Access Control Assistance Operators, Administrators, Backup Operators, Cryptographic Operators, Device Owners, Distributed COM Users, Event Log Readers, Guests, Hyper-V Administrators, IIS_IUSRS, Network Configuration Operators, Performance Log Users, Performance Monitor Users, Power Users, Remote Desktop Users, Remote Management Users, Replicator, System Managed Accounts Group, Users, Administrator, DefaultAccount, Guest, DESKTOP-QH154P8\rick, WDAGUtilityAccount, NETWORK SERVICE, LOCAL SERVICE, SYSTEM, IUSR, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Authenticated Users, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, PROXY, ANONYMOUS LOGON, SERVICE, INTERACTIVE, BATCH, NETWORK, DIALUP, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, CREATOR GROUP, CREATOR OWNER, Everyone, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES, Window Manager\Window Manager Group

    V-253486 - The "Create a token object" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253486r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000045
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Create a token object" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

    Title:WN11-UR-000045 - The "Create a token object" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Create a token object" user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.

      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Create a token object - None)

    Title:Create a token object - None
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000008 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '.+'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25348600 (accesstoken_state)

    V-253490 - The "Debug programs" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253490r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000065
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Debug Programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components. This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Debug programs" to only include the following groups or accounts:

    Administrators
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253490
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-UR-000065 - The "Debug programs" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Debug Programs" user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components. This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Debug Programs - Administrators)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349000 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Debug Programs - Administrators
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000009 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'Administrators'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349000 (accesstoken_state)

    [ true ]
