    • sedebugprivilege equals '0' for LOCAL SERVICE, Network Configuration Operators, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, Replicator, Power Users, Distributed COM Users, Performance Monitor Users, Guest, Remote Desktop Users, NETWORK, System Managed Accounts Group, DIALUP, Administrator, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Hyper-V Administrators, ANONYMOUS LOGON, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES, BATCH, INTERACTIVE, Window Manager\Window Manager Group, Everyone, Authenticated Users, IIS_IUSRS, Users, CREATOR GROUP, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, WDAGUtilityAccount, DefaultAccount, SYSTEM, Event Log Readers, Cryptographic Operators, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, Remote Management Users, CREATOR OWNER, Backup Operators, SERVICE, DESKTOP-QH154P8\rick, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, Device Owners, Performance Log Users, IUSR, NETWORK SERVICE, PROXY, Guests, Access Control Assistance Operators

    V-253264 - The Windows 11 system must use an antivirus program.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253264r828876_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000045
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Malicious software can establish a base on individual desktops and servers. Employing an automated mechanism to detect this type of software will aid in elimination of the software from the operating system.
    Fix Text:Install Microsoft Defender Antivirus or a third-party antivirus solution.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Malicious software can establish a base on individual desktops and servers. Employing an automated mechanism to detect this type of software will aid in elimination of the software from the operating system.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:201
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The Windows 11 system must use an antivirus program.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-253264, SV-253264r828876, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-253264, SV-253264r828876, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:201
    Question:Verify an antivirus solution is installed on the system and in use. The antivirus solution may be bundled with an approved Endpoint Security Solution.

    Verify if Microsoft Defender Antivirus is in use or enabled:

    Open "PowerShell".

    Enter "get-service | where {$_.DisplayName -Like "*Defender*"} | Select Status,DisplayName"

    Verify third-party antivirus is in use or enabled:

    Open "PowerShell".

    Enter "get-service | where {$_.DisplayName -Like "*mcafee*"} | Select Status,DisplayName"

    Enter "get-service | where {$_.DisplayName -Like "*symantec*"} | Select Status,DisplayName"

    If there is no antivirus solution installed on the system, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253269 - Only accounts responsible for the administration of a system must have Administrator rights on the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253269r828891_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000070
    Identities:CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    Description: An account that does not have Administrator duties must not have Administrator rights. Such rights would allow the account to bypass or modify required security restrictions on that machine and make it vulnerable to attack.

    System administrators must log on to systems only using accounts with the minimum level of authority necessary.

    For domain-joined workstations, the Domain Admins group must be replaced by a domain workstation administrator group (see V-36434 in the Active Directory Domain STIG). Restricting highly privileged accounts from the local Administrators group helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation resulting from credential theft attacks.

    Standard user accounts must not be members of the local administrators group.
    Fix Text:Configure the system to include only administrator groups or accounts that are responsible for the system in the local Administrators group.

    For domain-joined workstations, the Domain Admins group must be replaced by a domain workstation administrator group.

    Remove any standard user accounts.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: An account that does not have Administrator duties must not have Administrator rights. Such rights would allow the account to bypass or modify required security restrictions on that machine and make it vulnerable to attack. System administrators must log on to systems only using accounts with the minimum level of authority necessary. For domain-joined workstations, the Domain Admins group must be replaced by a domain workstation administrator group (see V-36434 in the Active Directory Domain STIG). Restricting highly privileged accounts from the local Administrators group helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation resulting from credential theft attacks. Standard user accounts must not be members of the local administrators group.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:301
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Only accounts responsible for the administration of a system must have Administrator rights on the system.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-253269, SV-253269r828891, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00123)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-253269, SV-253269r828891, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00123
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:301
    Question:Run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Groups.
    Review the members of the Administrators group.
    Only the appropriate administrator groups or accounts responsible for administration of the system may be members of the group.

    For domain-joined workstations, the Domain Admins group must be replaced by a domain workstation administrator group.

    Standard user accounts must not be members of the local administrator group.

    If prohibited accounts are members of the local administrators group, this is a finding.

    The built-in Administrator account or other required administrative accounts would not be a finding.

    References:
    CCI-002165
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253294 - Administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253294r828966_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000240
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Using applications that access the internet or have potential internet sources using administrative privileges exposes a system to compromise. If a flaw in an application is exploited while running as a privileged user, the entire system could be compromised. Web browsers and email are common attack vectors for introducing malicious code and must not be run with an administrative account.

    Since administrative accounts may generally change or work around technical restrictions for running a web browser or other applications, it is essential that policy requires administrative accounts to not access the internet or use applications, such as email.

    The policy must define specific exceptions for local service administration. These exceptions may include HTTP(S)-based tools that are used for the administration of the local system, services, or attached devices.

    Technical means such as application allowlisting can be used to enforce the policy to ensure compliance.
    Fix Text:Establish and enforce a policy that prohibits administrative accounts from using applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email. Define specific exceptions for local service administration. These exceptions may include HTTP(S)-based tools that are used for the administration of the local system, services, or attached devices.

    Implement technical measures where feasible such as removal of applications or use of application allowlisting to restrict the use of applications that can access the internet.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Using applications that access the internet or have potential internet sources using administrative privileges exposes a system to compromise. If a flaw in an application is exploited while running as a privileged user, the entire system could be compromised. Web browsers and email are common attack vectors for introducing malicious code and must not be run with an administrative account. Since administrative accounts may generally change or work around technical restrictions for running a web browser or other applications, it is essential that policy requires administrative accounts to not access the internet or use applications, such as email. The policy must define specific exceptions for local service administration. These exceptions may include HTTP(S)-based tools that are used for the administration of the local system, services, or attached devices. Technical means such as application allowlisting can be used to enforce the policy to ensure compliance.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:801
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-253294, SV-253294r828966, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-253294, SV-253294r828966, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:801
    Question:Determine whether administrative accounts are prevented from using applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email, except as necessary for local service administration.

    The organization must have a policy that prohibits administrative accounts from using applications that access the internet, such as web browsers, or with potential internet sources, such as email, except as necessary for local service administration. The policy must define specific exceptions for local service administration. These exceptions may include HTTP(S)-based tools that are used for the administration of the local system, services, or attached devices.

    Technical measures such as the removal of applications or application allowlisting must be used where feasible to prevent the use of applications that access the internet.

    If accounts with administrative privileges are not prevented from using applications that access the internet or with potential internet sources, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253370 - Credential Guard must be running on Windows 11 domain-joined systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253370r829194_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-CC-000075
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect information that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. This authentication information, which was stored in the Local Security Authority (LSA) in previous versions of Windows, is isolated from the rest of operating system and can only be accessed by privileged system software.
    Fix Text:Virtualization-based security, including Credential Guard, currently cannot be implemented in virtual desktop implementations (VDI) due to specific supporting requirements including a TPM, UEFI with Secure Boot, and the capability to run the Hyper-V feature within the virtual desktop.

    For VDIs where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    For VDIs with persistent desktops, this may be downgraded to a CAT II only where administrators have specific tokens for the VDI. Administrator accounts on virtual desktops must only be used on systems in the VDI; they may not have administrative privileges on any other systems such as servers and physical workstations.

    Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Device Guard >> "Turn On virtualization-based Security" to "Enabled" with "Enabled with UEFI lock" selected for "Credential Guard Configuration:".


    A Microsoft TechNet article on Credential Guard, including system requirement details, can be found at the following link:

    https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/access-protection/credential-guard/credential-guard
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect information that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. This authentication information, which was stored in the Local Security Authority (LSA) in previous versions of Windows, is isolated from the rest of operating system and can only be accessed by privileged system software.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:2321
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Credential Guard must be running on Windows 11 domain-joined systems.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT I, V-253370, SV-253370r829194, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT I, V-253370, SV-253370r829194, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:2321
    Question:Confirm Credential Guard is running on domain-joined systems.

    For those devices that support Credential Guard, this feature must be enabled. Organizations need to take the appropriate action to acquire and implement compatible hardware with Credential Guard enabled.

    Virtualization-based security, including Credential Guard, currently cannot be implemented in virtual desktop implementations (VDI) due to specific supporting requirements including a TPM, UEFI with Secure Boot, and the capability to run the Hyper-V feature within the virtual desktop.

    For VDIs where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    Run "PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).
    Enter the following:
    "Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_DeviceGuard -Namespace root\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceGuard"

    If "SecurityServicesRunning" does not include a value of "1" (e.g., "{1, 2}"), this is a finding.

    Alternately:

    Run "System Information".
    Under "System Summary", verify the following:
    If "virtualization-based Services Running" does not list "Credential Guard", this is finding.

    The policy settings referenced in the Fix section will configure the following registry value. However, due to hardware requirements, the registry value alone does not ensure proper function.

    Registry Hive: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
    Registry Path: \SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceGuard\

    Value Name: LsaCfgFlags
    Value Type: REG_DWORD
    Value: 0x00000001 (1) (Enabled with UEFI lock)

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

Detailed Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    V-253259 - Windows 11 information systems must use BitLocker to encrypt all disks to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253259r877379_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000030
    Identities:CCI-002475 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-28 (1))
    Description: If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running.
    Fix Text:Enable full disk encryption on all information systems (including SIPRNet) using BitLocker.

    BitLocker, included in Windows, can be enabled in the Control Panel under "BitLocker Drive Encryption" as well as other management tools.

    Note: An alternate encryption application may be used in lieu of BitLocker providing it is configured for full disk encryption and satisfies the pre-boot authentication requirements (WN11-00-000031 and WN11-00-000032).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253259
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000030 - Windows 11 information systems must use BitLocker to encrypt all disks to protect the confidentiality and integrity of all information at rest.
    Description:If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25325900 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:BitLocker must be enabled on all fixed drives.
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25325900 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2\security\microsoftvolumeencryption'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT protectionstatus FROM win32_encryptablevolume'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25325900 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all protectionstatus must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2\security\microsoftvolumeencryption'
    • wql equals 'SELECT protectionstatus FROM win32_encryptablevolume'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • protectionstatus = '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-253260 - Windows 11 systems must use a BitLocker PIN for pre-boot authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253260r877378_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000031
    Identities:CCI-002476 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-28 (1))
    Description: If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running. Pre-boot authentication prevents unauthorized users from accessing encrypted drives.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> BitLocker Drive Encryption >> Operating System Drives "Require additional authentication at startup" to "Enabled" with "Configure TPM Startup PIN:" set to "Require startup PIN with TPM" or with "Configure TPM startup key and PIN:" set to "Require startup key and PIN with TPM".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253260
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000031 - Windows 11 systems must use a BitLocker PIN for pre-boot authentication.
    Description:If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running. Pre-boot authentication prevents unauthorized users from accessing encrypted drives.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false ('Configure TPM startup PIN' is set to 'Require startup PIN with TPM'.)
              • false ('Configure TPM startup key and PIN' is set to 'Require startup key and PIN with TPM'.)
            • true ('Allow network unlock at startup' is Enabled.) (negated)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
              • false ('Configure TPM startup PIN' is set to 'Allow startup PIN with TPM'.)
              • false ('Configure TPM startup key and PIN' is set to 'Allow startup key and PIN with TPM'.)
            • false ('Allow network unlock at startup' is Enabled.)
        • false ('Require additional authentication at startup' is Enabled.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326002 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure TPM startup PIN' is set to 'Require startup PIN with TPM'.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326002 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\FVE'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'UseTPMPIN'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326003 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure TPM startup key and PIN' is set to 'Require startup key and PIN with TPM'.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326003 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\FVE'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'UseTPMKeyPIN'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    Title:'Allow network unlock at startup' is Enabled.

    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\FVE'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'OSManageNKP'

    V-253261 - Windows 11 systems must use a BitLocker PIN with a minimum length of six digits for pre-boot authentication.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253261r828867_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000032
    Identities:CCI-000804 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-8; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-8.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-8)
    Description: If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running. Pre-boot authentication prevents unauthorized users from accessing encrypted drives. Increasing the pin length requires a greater number of guesses for an attacker.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> BitLocker Drive Encryption >> Operating System Drives "Configure minimum PIN length for startup" to "Enabled" with "Minimum characters:" set to "6" or greater.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253261
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000032 - Windows 11 systems must use a BitLocker PIN with a minimum length of six digits for pre-boot authentication.
    Description:If data at rest is unencrypted, it is vulnerable to disclosure. Even if the operating system enforces permissions on data access, an adversary can remove non-volatile memory and read it directly, thereby circumventing operating system controls. Encrypting the data ensures that confidentiality is protected even when the operating system is not running. Pre-boot authentication prevents unauthorized users from accessing encrypted drives. Increasing the pin length requires a greater number of guesses for an attacker.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (BitLocker must be 6 digits or more.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25326100 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:BitLocker must be 6 digits or more.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25326100 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\FVE'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'MinimumPIN'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25326100 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '6'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253276 - Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) must not be installed on the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253276r828912_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000105
    Identities:CCI-000382 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 b)
    Description: "SNMP" is not installed by default. Some protocols and services do not support required security features, such as encrypting passwords or traffic.
    Fix Text:Uninstall "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)" from the system.

    Run "Programs and Features".
    Select "Turn Windows Features on or off".
    De-select "Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP)".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:441
    Result:true
    Title:SRG-OS-000096-GPOS-00050, SV-253276r828912
    Description:Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) must not be installed on the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (SNMP Shall Not Be Installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:441 (service_test)
    Result:true
    Title:SNMP Shall Not Be Installed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:441 (service_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • service_name must be equal to 'SNMP'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • service_name does not exist

    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000110
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: "Simple TCP/IP Services" is not installed by default. Some protocols and services do not support required security features, such as encrypting passwords or traffic.
    Fix Text:Uninstall "Simple TCPIP Services (i.e. echo, daytime etc.)" from the system.

    V-253285 - The Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature must be disabled on the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253285r828939_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000155
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Windows PowerShell 5.0 added advanced logging features which can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.0 script block logging feature.
    Fix Text:Disable "Windows PowerShell 2.0" on the system.

    Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).
    Enter the following:
    Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root

    This command must disable both "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root" and "MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2" which correspond to "Windows PowerShell 2.0" and "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine" respectively in "Turn Windows features on or off".

    Alternately:
    Search for "Features".
    Select "Turn Windows features on or off".
    De-select "Windows PowerShell 2.0".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253285
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000155 - The Windows PowerShell 2.0 feature must be disabled on the system.
    Description:Windows PowerShell 5.0 added advanced logging features which can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.0 script block logging feature.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Windows PowerShell 2.0 optional feature is disabled)
        • false (Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine optional feature is disabled)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328500 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 optional feature is disabled
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328500 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328500 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2Root''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '1'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328501 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine optional feature is disabled
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328501 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328500 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'MicrosoftWindowsPowerShellV2''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '1'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-253286 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253286r828942_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000160
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older Network Attached Storage (NAS) devices may only support SMBv1.
    Fix Text:Disable the SMBv1 protocol.

    Run "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).

    Enter the following:
    Disable-WindowsOptionalFeature -Online -FeatureName SMB1Protocol

    Alternately:
    Search for "Features".

    Select "Turn Windows features on or off".

    De-select "SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253286
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-00-000160 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the system.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older Network Attached Storage (NAS) devices may only support SMBv1.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
            • false ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
            • false ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328600 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '2'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328700 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328800 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name must be equal to 'Start'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000004 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253287 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253287r828945_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000165
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories, respectively.

    The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253287
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-00-000165 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
        • false ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328600 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '2'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328700 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253288 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253288r828948_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-00-000170
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories, respectively.

    The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253288
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-00-000170 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
    Description:SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.

    Disabling SMBv1 support may prevent access to file or print sharing resources with systems or devices that only support SMBv1. File shares and print services hosted on Windows Server 2003 are an example, however Windows Server 2003 is no longer a supported operating system. Some older network attached devices may only support SMBv1.

    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.

    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]

    V-253289 - The Secondary Logon service must be disabled on Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253289r828951_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-00-000175
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: The Secondary Logon service provides a means for entering alternate credentials, typically used to run commands with elevated privileges. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft.
    Fix Text:Configure the "Secondary Logon" service "Startup Type" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253289
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-00-000175 - The Secondary Logon service must be disabled on Windows 11.
    Description:The Secondary Logon service provides a means for entering alternate credentials, typically used to run commands with elevated privileges. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (The Secondary Logon service Startup Type is Disabled or the service is uninstalled)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25328900 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:The Secondary Logon service Startup Type is Disabled or the service is uninstalled
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25328900 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT startmode FROM Win32_Service WHERE name='seclogon''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25328900 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all startmode must be equal to 'Disabled'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT startmode FROM Win32_Service WHERE name='seclogon''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • startmode = 'Manual'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-253297 - Windows 11 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253297r828975_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000005
    Identities:CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 b)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the amount of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout duration" to "15" minutes or greater.

    A value of "0" is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253297
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000005 - Windows 11 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the amount of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false ('Account lockout duration' is set to '0')
          • true ('Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater)
        • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329700 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329700 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be less than or equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329701 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be equal to '4294967295'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_duration
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329701 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '15 minutes' or greater
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329702 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be greater than or equal to '900'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_threshold

    V-253298 - The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to three or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253298r828978_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000010
    Identities:CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack, while allowing for honest errors made during a normal user logon.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout threshold" to "3" or less invalid logon attempts (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253298
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000010 - The number of allowed bad logon attempts must be configured to three or less.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack, while allowing for honest errors made during a normal user logon.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less)
        • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329800 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329800 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be less than or equal to '3'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_threshold

    V-253299 - The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253299r828981_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000015
    Identities:CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to 0. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Reset account lockout counter after" to "15" minutes.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253299
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000015 - The period of time before the bad logon counter is reset must be configured to 15 minutes.
    Description:The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to 0. The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least the required value)
        • false ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329900 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least the required value
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329900 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_observation_window must be greater than or equal to '900'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000001 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25329801 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_duration equals '1800'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_threshold

    V-253300 - The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253300r828984_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000020
    Identities:CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
    Description: A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change a password to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is 24 for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Enforce password history" to "24" passwords remembered.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253300
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000020 - The password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.
    Description:A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change a password to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is 24 for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330000 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330000 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', password_hist_len must be greater than or equal to '24'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    password_hist_len

    V-253301 - The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253301r828987_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AC-000025
    Identities:CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Maximum Password Age" to "60" days or less (excluding "0" which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253301
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AC-000025 - The maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.
    Description:The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Maximum Password Age is set to 60 days or less, but greater than 0.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330100 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Maximum Password Age is set to 60 days or less, but greater than 0.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330100 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be less than or equal to '5184000'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330101 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-253302 - The minimum password age must be configured to at least 1 day.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253302r828990_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000030
    Identities:CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum Password Age" to at least "1" day.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253302
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000030 - The minimum password age must be configured to at least 1 day.
    Description:Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330200 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330200 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', min_passwd_age must be greater than or equal to '86400'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    min_passwd_age

    V-253303 - Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253303r857206_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000035
    Identities:CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password length" to "14" characters.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253303
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000035 - Passwords must, at a minimum, be 14 characters.
    Description:Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330300 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    Object Requirements:

    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330300 (passwordpolicy_state)

    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    min_passwd_len

    V-253304 - The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253304r828996_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AC-000040
    Identities:CCI-000192 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: The use of complex passwords increases their strength against guessing and brute-force attacks. This setting configures the system to verify that newly created passwords conform to the Windows password complexity policy.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Password must meet complexity requirements" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253304
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AC-000040 - The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.
    Description:The use of complex passwords increases their strength against guessing and brute-force attacks. This setting configures the system to verify that newly created passwords conform to the Windows password complexity policy.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330400 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330400 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', password_complexity must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3628800'
    • min_passwd_age equals '0'
    • min_passwd_len equals '0'
    • password_hist_len equals '0'
    • password_complexity equals '0'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    password_complexity

    V-253306 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253306r829002_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000005
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> "Audit Credential Validation" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253306
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000005 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Failure')
        • false ('Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Credential Validation' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', credential_validation must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
