    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253307 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253307r829005_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000010
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)

    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253308 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253308r877036_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000030
    Identities:CCI-001914 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 (3); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 (3))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting or changing of security groups, including changes in group members.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Security Group Management" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253308
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000030 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting or changing of security groups, including changes in group members.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Audit Security Group Management' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Audit Security Group Management' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', security_group_management must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330801 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', security_group_management must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    V-253309 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253309r829011_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000035
    Identities:CCI-001314 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 c; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 b)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

    V-253310 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253310r829014_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000040
    Identities:CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253310
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000040 - The system must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.     User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.
    Class:compliance

    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success')
        • false ('Audit User Account Management' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', user_account_management must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    V-253311 - The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253311r829017_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000045
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Plug and Play activity records events related to the successful connection of external devices.
    Fix Text:Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit PNP Activity" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:1141
    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000365-GPOS-00152, SV-253311r829017
    Description:The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled)
      • false (Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:10000 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:10000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name must be equal to 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:41 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:1141 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:1141 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:1141 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', pnp_activity, all of the following must be true:
      • pnp_activity must match the pattern 'AUDIT_(SUCCESS|SUCCESS_FAILURE)'

    V-253312 - The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253312r829020_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000050
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001814 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-5 (1))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Process creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit Process Creation" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA

    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Process creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.

    V-253313 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253313r829023_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000054
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Account Lockout" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253313
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000054 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Account Lockout failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Account Lockout events can be used to identify potentially malicious logon attempts.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Account Lockout' is set to 'Failure')
        • false ('Audit Account Lockout' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:25331300 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false

    V-253314 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253314r829026_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000060
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Group Membership records information related to the group membership of a user's logon token.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Group Membership" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:1201
    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000458-GPOS-00203, SV-253314r829026
    Description:The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled)
      • false (Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:10000 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:10000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name must be equal to 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:41 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:1201 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Logon/Logoff - Group Membership successes.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:1141 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:1201 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', group_membership, all of the following must be true:
      • group_membership must match the pattern 'AUDIT_(SUCCESS|SUCCESS_FAILURE)'

    V-253315 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253315r829029_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000065
    Identities:CCI-000067 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (1))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logoff records user logoffs. If this is an interactive logoff, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logoff" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253315
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000065 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logoff records user logoffs. If this is an interactive logoff, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - Logoff - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Logoff - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

    V-253316 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253316r829032_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000070
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logon" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253316
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000070 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Failure')
        • true ('Audit Logon' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Logon' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25331600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', logon must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    logon
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331601 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

    V-253317 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253317r829035_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000075
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Logon" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253317
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000075 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logon successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Logon records user logons. If this is an interactive logon, it is recorded on the local system. If it is to a network share, it is recorded on the system accessed.

    V-253318 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253318r829038_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000080
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Special Logon records special logons which have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Special Logon" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253318
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000080 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Special Logon records special logons which have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - Special Logon - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Special Logon - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit - Special Logon - Success only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • Collect any available items.

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', special_logon must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_creation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    special_logon

    V-253319 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253319r829041_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000081
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing file shares records events related to connection to shares on a system including system shares such as C$.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit File Share" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253319
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000081 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing file shares records events related to connection to shares on a system including system shares such as C$.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit File Share' is set to 'Failure')
        • false ('Audit File Share' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25331900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit File Share' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25331900 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_share must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253320 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - File Share successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253320r829044_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000082
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)

Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    V-253321 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253321r829047_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000083
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Other Object Access Events" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253321
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000083 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.

    other_object_access_events
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332101 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.

    • Collect any available items.

    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    other_object_access_events

    V-253322 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253322r829050_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000084
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Other Object Access Events" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253322
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000084 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Object Access - Other Object Access Events failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing for other object access records events related to the management of task scheduler jobs and COM+ objects.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Failure')
        • false ('Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332200 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Other Object Access Events' is set to 'Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332200 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_object_access_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253325 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Audit Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253325r829059_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000100
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Policy Change records events related to changes in audit policy.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Policy Change" with "Success" selected.

    Weight:10.0

    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11

    V-253326 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253326r829062_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000105
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authentication Policy Change records events related to changes in authentication policy including Kerberos policy and Trust changes.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authentication Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253326
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000105 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authentication Policy Change successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authentication Policy Change records events related to changes in authentication policy including Kerberos policy and Trust changes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Audit Authentication Policy Change' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Audit Authentication Policy Change' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', authentication_policy_change must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25332601 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', authentication_policy_change must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253327 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253327r829065_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000107
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authorization Policy Change records events related to changes in user rights, such as create a token object.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> "Audit Authorization Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253327
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000107 - The system must be configured to audit Policy Change - Authorization Policy Change successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Authorization Policy Change records events related to changes in user rights, such as create a token object.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25332700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit - Audit Policy Change - Success only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)

    • Collect any available items.

    V-253328 - The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253328r829068_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000110
    Identities:CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Privilege Use >> "Audit Sensitive Privilege Use" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253328
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000110 - The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Sensitive Privilege Use records events related to use of sensitive privileges, such as "Act as part of the operating system" or "Debug programs".

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Sensitive Privilege Use' is set to 'Failure' or 'Success and Failure')

    V-253329 - The system must be configured to audit Privilege Use - Sensitive Privilege Use successes.

    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    sensitive_privilege_use

    V-253330 - The system must be configured to audit System - IPsec Driver failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253330r829074_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000120
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    IPsec Driver records events related to the IPsec Driver such as dropped packets.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit IPsec Driver" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253330
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000120 - The system must be configured to audit System - IPsec Driver failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    IPsec Driver records events related to the IPsec Driver such as dropped packets.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - IPSec Driver - Failure only)
        • false (Audit - IPSec Driver - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit - IPSec Driver - Failure only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', ipsec_driver must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253331 - The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253331r829077_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000130
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Other System Events" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253331
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000130 - The system must be configured to audit System - Other System Events successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other System Events records information related to cryptographic key operations and the Windows Firewall service.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Other System Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333100 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Other System Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_system_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    V-253333 - The system must be configured to audit System - Security State Change successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253333r829083_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000140
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security State Change records events related to changes in the security state, such as startup and shutdown of the system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security State Change" with "Success" selected.

    V-253334 - The system must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253334r829086_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000150
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security System Extension records events related to extension code being loaded by the security subsystem.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit Security System Extension" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253334
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000150 - The system must be configured to audit System - Security System Extension successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security System Extension records events related to extension code being loaded by the security subsystem.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success')
        • false ('Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success' and 'Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333400 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Audit Security System Extension' is set to 'Success'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-253335 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253335r829089_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000155
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit System Integrity" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253335
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000155 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem.

    • true (All child checks must be true.)

    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253336 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253336r829092_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000160
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> System >> "Audit System Integrity" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253336
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000160 - The system must be configured to audit System - System Integrity successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    System Integrity records events related to violations of integrity to the security subsystem.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Audit - System Integrity - Success only)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit - System Integrity - Success only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', system_integrity must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333601 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', system_integrity must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_logon_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • computer_account_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • distribution_group_management equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_account_management_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authentication_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • authorization_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253337 - The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253337r877391_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000500
    Identities:CCI-001849 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4)
    Description: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
    Fix Text:If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this is NA. This must be documented with the ISSO.

    Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Application >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "32768" or greater.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253337
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000500 - The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
    Description:Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (The Application event log size is configured to 32768 KB or greater)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333700 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:The Application event log size is configured to 32768 KB or greater
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25333700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal (case insensitive) to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal (case insensitive) to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Application'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'MaxSize'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333700 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '32768'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253338 - The Security event log size must be configured to 1024000 KB or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253338r877391_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000505
    Identities:CCI-001849 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-4)
    Description: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Security >> "Specify the maximum log file size (KB)" to "Enabled" with a "Maximum Log Size (KB)" of "1024000" or greater.

    If the system is configured to send audit records directly to an audit server, this must be documented with the ISSO.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253338
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000505 - The Security event log size must be configured to 1024000 KB or greater.
    Description:Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (The Security event log size is configured to 1024000 KB or greater)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25333800 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:The Security event log size is configured to 1024000 KB or greater
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25333800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal (case insensitive) to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal (case insensitive) to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\EventLog\Security'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'MaxSize'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25333800 (registry_state)
