    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '1024000'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000510

    V-253340 - Windows 11 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253340r829104_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000515
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the Application event log (Application.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253340
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000515 - Windows 11 permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334001 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334003 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334002 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334002 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092840000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\WINDOWS\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334000 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334000 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'

    V-253341 - Windows 11 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253341r829107_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000520
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the Security event log (Security.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253341
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000520 - Windows 11 permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)

    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334102 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334102 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Security'
    • name must be equal to 'file'

    Collected Item/State Result:

    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Security'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133402746480000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\System32\winevt\Logs\Security.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\WINDOWS\System32\winevt\Logs\Security.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334100 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334100 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:

    V-253342 - Windows 11 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253342r829110_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-AU-000525
    Identities:CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Fix Text:Ensure the permissions on the System event log (System.evtx) are configured to prevent standard user accounts or groups from having access. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement.

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\SYSTEM32\WINEVT\LOGS" directory.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253342
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-AU-000525 - Windows 11 permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334201 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334203 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334202 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334202 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133402746480000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\WINDOWS\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334200 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334200 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-15-2-1'

    V-253343 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Other Policy Change Events Successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253343r829113_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000550
    Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other Policy Change Events contains events about EFS Data Recovery Agent policy changes, changes in Windows Filtering Platform filter, status on Security policy settings updates for local Group Policy settings, Central Access Policy changes, and detailed troubleshooting events for Cryptographic Next Generation (CNG) operations.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change>> "Audit Other Policy Change Events" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253343
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000550 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Other Policy Change Events Successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other Policy Change Events contains events about EFS Data Recovery Agent policy changes, changes in Windows Filtering Platform filter, status on Security policy settings updates for local Group Policy settings, Central Access Policy changes, and detailed troubleshooting events for Cryptographic Next Generation (CNG) operations.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Other Policy Change Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334300 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Other Policy Change Events' is set to 'Success' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334300 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_policy_change_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334301 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_policy_change_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_service_ticket_operations equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_ticket_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • security_group_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • user_account_management equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • dpapi_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    • process_termination equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • rpc_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_access equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_changes equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_directory_service_replication equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • account_lockout equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • ipsec_extended_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_main_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_quick_mode equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • logoff equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • network_policy_server equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'
    • other_logon_logoff_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • special_logon equals 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    • logon_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • application_generated equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • certification_services equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • detailed_file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_share equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • file_system equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_connection equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • filtering_platform_packet_drop equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • handle_manipulation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kernel_object equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_object_access_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • registry equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sam equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • removable_storage equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • central_access_policy_staging equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-253345 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit other Logon/Logoff Events Successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253345r829119_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000560
    Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events determines whether Windows generates audit events for other logon or logoff events. Logon events are essential to understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Logon/Logoff >> "Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253345
    Result:false

Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Other Logon/Logoff Events determines whether Windows generates audit events for other logon or logoff events. Logon events are essential to understanding user activity and detecting potential attacks.
    Class:compliance

    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334500 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_logon_logoff_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'

    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334600 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', other_logon_logoff_events must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334601 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:

    other_logon_logoff_events

    V-253347 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Detailed File Share Failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253347r829125_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000570
    Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Detailed File Share allows the user to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.
    The Detailed File Share setting logs an event every time a file or folder is accessed, whereas the File Share setting only records one event for any connection established between a client and file share. Detailed File Share audit events include detailed information about the permissions or other criteria used to grant or deny access.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> Audit Detailed File Share" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253347
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-AU-000570 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit Detailed File Share Failures.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit Detailed File Share allows the user to audit attempts to access files and folders on a shared folder.
    The Detailed File Share setting logs an event every time a file or folder is accessed, whereas the File Share setting only records one event for any connection established between a client and file share. Detailed File Share audit events include detailed information about the permissions or other criteria used to grant or deny access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Detailed File Share' is set to 'Failure' or 'Success and Failure')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Detailed File Share' is set to 'Failure' or 'Success and Failure'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000000 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334700 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', detailed_file_share must be equal to 'AUDIT_FAILURE'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25334701 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', detailed_file_share must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS_FAILURE'

    V-253348 - Windows 11 must be configured to audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change Successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253348r829128_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-AU-000575
    Identities:CCI-000130 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change determines whether the operating system generates audit events when changes are made to policy rules for the Microsoft Protection Service (MPSSVC.exe).
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Policy Change >> Audit MPSSVC Rule-Level Policy Change" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA

    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

    V-253352 - The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253352r829140_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000010
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Slide shows that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel. Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged on user.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Control Panel >> Personalization >> "Prevent enabling lock screen slide show" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253352
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000010 - The display of slide shows on the lock screen must be disabled.
    Description:Slide shows that are displayed on the lock screen could display sensitive information to unauthorized personnel. Turning off this feature will limit access to the information to a logged on user.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Verifies 'Prevent enabling lock screen slide show' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335200 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Verifies 'Prevent enabling lock screen slide show' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25335200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Personalization'
    • name must be equal to 'NoLockScreenSlideshow'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253353 - IPv6 source routing must be configured to highest protection.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253353r829143_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000020
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Configuring the system to disable IPv6 source routing protects against spoofing.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MSS (Legacy) >> "MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)" to "Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled".

    This policy setting requires the installation of the MSS-Legacy custom templates included with the STIG package. "MSS-Legacy.admx" and "MSS-Legacy.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253353
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000020 - IPv6 source routing must be configured to highest protection.
    Description:Configuring the system to disable IPv6 source routing protects against spoofing.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335300 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' is set to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25335300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Services\Tcpip6\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'DisableIPSourceRouting'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000002 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253358 - WDigest Authentication must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253358r829158_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000038
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: When the WDigest Authentication protocol is enabled, plain text passwords are stored in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) exposing them to theft. WDigest is disabled by default in Windows 11. This setting ensures this is enforced.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "WDigest Authentication (disabling may require KB2871997)" to "Disabled".

    The patch referenced in the policy title is not required for Windows 11.

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253358
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000038 - WDigest Authentication must be disabled.
    Description:When the WDigest Authentication protocol is enabled, plain text passwords are stored in the Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (LSASS) exposing them to theft. WDigest is disabled by default in Windows 11. This setting ensures this is enforced.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (WDigest Authentication is disabled)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335800 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:WDigest Authentication is disabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25335800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\Wdigest'
    • name must be equal to 'UseLogonCredential'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253359 - Run as different user must be removed from context menus.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253359r829161_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000039
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: The "Run as different user" selection from context menus allows the use of credentials other than the currently logged on user. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft. Removing this option from context menus helps prevent this from occurring.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Remove "Run as Different User" from context menus" to "Enabled".

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253359
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000039 - Run as different user must be removed from context menus.
    Description:The "Run as different user" selection from context menus allows the use of credentials other than the currently logged on user. Using privileged credentials in a standard user session can expose those credentials to theft. Removing this option from context menus helps prevent this from occurring.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Remove 'Run as Different User' from context menus' is set to 'Enabled' (batfile))
        • false ('Remove 'Run as Different User' from context menus' is set to 'Enabled' (cmdfile))
        • false ('Remove 'Run as Different User' from context menus' is set to 'Enabled' (exefile))
        • false ('Remove 'Run as Different User' from context menus' is set to 'Enabled' (mscfile))
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335900 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Remove 'Run as Different User' from context menus' is set to 'Enabled' (batfile)
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25335900 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Classes\batfile\shell\runasuser'
    • name must be equal to 'SuppressionPolicy'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25335900 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4096'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335901 (registry_test)

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25335901 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Classes\cmdfile\shell\runasuser'
    • name must be equal to 'SuppressionPolicy'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25335900 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4096'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25335902 (registry_test)
    Result:false

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    V-253360 - Insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253360r829164_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000040
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Insecure guest logons allow unauthenticated access to shared folders. Shared resources on a system must require authentication to establish proper access.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Lanman Workstation >> "Enable insecure guest logons" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0

      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Enable insecure guest logons' is set to 'Disabled')

    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\LanmanWorkstation'

    V-253361 - Internet connection sharing must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253361r829167_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000044
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Internet connection sharing makes it possible for an existing internet connection, such as through wireless, to be shared and used by other systems essentially creating a mobile hotspot. This exposes the system sharing the connection to others with potentially malicious purpose.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Network Connections >> "Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253361
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000044 - Internet connection sharing must be disabled.
    Description:Internet connection sharing makes it possible for an existing internet connection, such as through wireless, to be shared and used by other systems essentially creating a mobile hotspot. This exposes the system sharing the connection to others with potentially malicious purpose.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25336100 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Prohibit use of Internet Connection Sharing on your DNS domain network' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336100 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Network Connections'
    • name must be equal to 'NC_ShowSharedAccessUI'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253364 - Simultaneous connections to the internet or a Windows domain must be limited.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253364r890455_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000055
    Identities:CCI-002418 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8)
    Description: Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and must be limited. The "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" setting prevents systems from automatically establishing multiple connections. When both wired and wireless connections are available, for example, the less preferred connection (typically wireless) will be disconnected.
    Fix Text:The default behavior for "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" is "Enabled".

    If this needs to be corrected, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Windows Connection Manager >> "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" to "Enabled". Under "Options", set "Minimize Policy Options" to "3 = Prevent Wi-Fi When on Ethernet".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253364
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000055 - Simultaneous connections to the internet or a Windows domain must be limited.
    Description:Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and must be limited. The "Minimize the number of simultaneous connections to the Internet or a Windows Domain" setting prevents systems from automatically establishing multiple connections. When both wired and wireless connections are available, for example, the less preferred connection (typically wireless) will be disconnected.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Simultaneous connections to the internet or a Windows domain are limited)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25336400 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Simultaneous connections to the internet or a Windows domain are limited
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WcmSvc\GroupPolicy'
    • name must be equal to 'fMinimizeConnections'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000003 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '3'

    V-253365 - Connections to non-domain networks when connected to a domain authenticated network must be blocked.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253365r829179_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000060
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and must be limited. When connected to a domain, communication must go through the domain connection.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> Windows Connection Manager >> "Prohibit connection to non-domain networks when connected to domain authenticated network" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

    Result:false

    Description:Multiple network connections can provide additional attack vectors to a system and must be limited. When connected to a domain, communication must go through the domain connection.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Prohibit connection to non-domain networks when connected to domain authenticated network' is set to 'Enabled')

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336500 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WcmSvc\GroupPolicy\'
    • name must be equal to 'fBlockNonDomain'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253366 - Wi-Fi Sense must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253366r829182_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000065
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Wi-Fi Sense automatically connects the system to known hotspots and networks that contacts have shared. It also allows the sharing of the system's known networks to contacts. Automatically connecting to hotspots and shared networks can expose a system to unsecured or potentially malicious systems.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Network >> WLAN Service >> WLAN Settings>> "Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid services" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253366
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000065 - Wi-Fi Sense must be disabled.
    Description:Wi-Fi Sense automatically connects the system to known hotspots and networks that contacts have shared. It also allows the sharing of the system's known networks to contacts. Automatically connecting to hotspots and shared networks can expose a system to unsecured or potentially malicious systems.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Verifies 'Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid service' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25336600 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Verifies 'Allow Windows to automatically connect to suggested open hotspots, to networks shared by contacts, and to hotspots offering paid service' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\WcmSvc\wifinetworkmanager\config'
    • name must be equal to 'AutoConnectAllowedOEM'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253367 - Command line data must be included in process creation events.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253367r829185_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000066
    Identities:CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling "Include command line data for process creation events" will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Audit Process Creation >> "Include command line in process creation events" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253367
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000066 - Command line data must be included in process creation events.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling "Include command line data for process creation events" will record the command line information with the process creation events in the log. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Include command line in process creation events' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25336700 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Include command line in process creation events' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System\Audit'
    • name must be equal to 'ProcessCreationIncludeCmdLine_Enabled'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253368 - Windows 11 must be configured to enable Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253368r829188_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000068
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: An exportable version of credentials is provided to remote hosts when using credential delegation which exposes them to theft on the remote host. Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard allow delegation of non-exportable credentials providing additional protection of the credentials. Enabling this configures the host to support Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Credentials Delegation >> "Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253368
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000068 - Windows 11 must be configured to enable Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials.
    Description:An exportable version of credentials is provided to remote hosts when using credential delegation which exposes them to theft on the remote host. Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard allow delegation of non-exportable credentials providing additional protection of the credentials. Enabling this configures the host to support Restricted Admin mode or Remote Credential Guard.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25336800 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Remote host allows delegation of non-exportable credentials' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25336800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\CredentialsDelegation'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowProtectedCreds'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253372 - Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253372r829200_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000085
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The default behavior is for Early Launch Antimalware - Boot-Start Driver Initialization policy is to enforce "Good, unknown and bad but critical" (preventing "bad"). By being launched first by the kernel, ELAM ( Early Launch Antimalware) is ensured to be launched before any third-party software, and is therefore able to detect malware in the boot process and prevent it from initializing.
    Fix Text:Ensure that Early Launch Antimalware - Boot-Start Driver Initialization policy is set to enforce "Good, unknown and bad but critical" (preventing "bad").

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Early Launch Antimalware >> "Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy" to "Enabled with "Good, unknown and bad but critical" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253372
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000085 - Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers.
    Description:The default behavior is for Early Launch Antimalware - Boot-Start Driver Initialization policy is to enforce "Good, unknown and bad but critical" (preventing "bad"). By being launched first by the kernel, ELAM ( Early Launch Antimalware) is ensured to be launched before any third-party software, and is therefore able to detect malware in the boot process and prevent it from initializing.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy' is not set to 'Enabled' with 'All' selected)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25337200 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy' is not set to 'Enabled' with 'All' selected
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25337200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Policies\EarlyLaunch'
    • name must be equal to 'DriverLoadPolicy'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000003 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '3'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25337200 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '8'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253373 - Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253373r829203_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000090
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Group Policy >> "Configure registry policy processing" to "Enabled" and select the option "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253373
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000090 - Group Policy objects must be reprocessed even if they have not changed.
    Description:Enabling this setting and then selecting the "Process even if the Group Policy objects have not changed" option ensures that the policies will be reprocessed even if none have been changed. This way, any unauthorized changes are forced to match the domain-based group policy settings again.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (NoGPOistChanges is set to 0.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25337300 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:NoGPOistChanges is set to 0.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25337300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Group Policy\{35378EAC-683F-11D2-A89A-00C04FBBCFA2}'
    • name must be equal to 'NoGPOListChanges'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253374 - Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253374r829206_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000100
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system. This setting prevents the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Internet Communication Management >> Internet Communication settings >> "Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253374
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000100 - Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.
    Description:Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system. This setting prevents the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25337400 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25337400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Printers'
    • name must be equal to 'DisableWebPnPDownload'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253376 - Printing over HTTP must be prevented.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253376r829212_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000110
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system. This setting prevents the client computer from printing over HTTP, which allows the computer to print to printers on the intranet as well as the internet.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Internet Communication Management >> Internet Communication settings >> "Turn off printing over HTTP" to "Enabled".

      • false (All child checks must be true.)

    V-253380 - Users must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep (on battery).

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253380r829224_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000145
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: Authentication must always be required when accessing a system. This setting ensures the user is prompted for a password on resume from sleep (on battery).

    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Power\PowerSettings\0e796bdb-100d-47d6-a2d5-f7d2daa51f51'

    V-253381 - The user must be prompted for a password on resume from sleep (plugged in).

    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Power\PowerSettings\0e796bdb-100d-47d6-a2d5-f7d2daa51f51'
    • name must be equal to 'ACSettingIndex'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253383 - Unauthenticated RPC clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253383r877039_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000165
    Identities:CCI-001967 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-3 (1))
    Description: Configuring RPC to restrict unauthenticated RPC clients from connecting to the RPC server will prevent anonymous connections.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Remote Procedure Call >> "Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients" to "Enabled" and "Authenticated".

    Weight:10.0

      • false (All child checks must be true.)

    Result:false
    Title:'Restrict Unauthenticated RPC clients' is set to 'Enabled' and 'Authenticated'

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Rpc'
    • name must be equal to 'RestrictRemoteClients'

    V-253391 - Administrator accounts must not be enumerated during elevation.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253391r829257_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000200
    Identities:CCI-001084 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-3.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-3)
    Description: Enumeration of administrator accounts when elevating can provide part of the logon information to an unauthorized user. This setting configures the system to always require users to type in a username and password to elevate a running application.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Credential User Interface >> "Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation" to "Disabled".

    Weight:10.0

    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

    Class:compliance

      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled')

    Result:false
    Title:'Enumerate administrator accounts on elevation' is set to 'Disabled'

    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).

    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\CredUI'
