    V-253392 - Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253392r829260_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000204
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Enhanced" level for telemetry includes additional information beyond "Security" and "Basic" on how Windows and apps are used and advanced reliability data. Windows Analytics can use a "limited enhanced" level to provide information such as health data for devices.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Data Collection and Preview Builds >> "Limit optional diagnostic data for Windows Analytics" to "Enabled" with "Enable Desktop Analytics collection" selected in "Options:".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:2761
    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227, SV-253392r829260
    Description:Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.)
      • false (Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:2761 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:2761 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
    • name must be equal to 'LimitEnhancedDiagnosticDataWindowsAnalytics'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:41 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:2762 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Enhanced diagnostic data must be limited to the minimum required to support Windows Analytics.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:2762 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowTelemetry'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:2761 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be less than or equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253393 - Windows Telemetry must not be configured to Full.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253393r857208_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000205
    Identities:CCI-001312 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-11 b; NIST SP 800-53A: SI-11.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-11 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-11 a)
    Description: Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Security" option for Telemetry configures the lowest amount of data, effectively none outside of the Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT), Defender and telemetry client settings. "Basic" sends basic diagnostic and usage data and may be required to support some Microsoft services. "Enhanced" includes additional information on how Windows and apps are used and advanced reliability data. Windows Analytics can use a "limited enhanced" level to provide information such as health data for devices.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Data Collection and Preview Builds >> "Allow Diagnostic Data" to "Enabled" with "Send required diagnostic data" selected in "Options:".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253393
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000205 - Windows Telemetry must not be configured to Full.
    Description:Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature. Limiting this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise. The "Security" option for Telemetry configures the lowest amount of data, effectively none outside of the Malicious Software Removal Tool (MSRT), Defender and telemetry client settings. "Basic" sends basic diagnostic and usage data and may be required to support some Microsoft services. "Enhanced" includes additional information on how Windows and apps are used and advanced reliability data. Windows Analytics can use a "limited enhanced" level to provide information such as health data for devices.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Allow Diagnostic Data' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Diagnostic Data Off (Not recommended)' or 'Send Required Diagnostic Data' selected in 'Options:')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25339300 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Allow Diagnostic Data' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Diagnostic Data Off (Not recommended)' or 'Send Required Diagnostic Data' selected in 'Options:'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25339300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DataCollection'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowTelemetry'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253395 - The Microsoft Defender SmartScreen for Explorer must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253395r829269_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000210
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Microsoft Defender SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Enabling Microsoft Defender SmartScreen will warn or prevent users from running potentially malicious programs.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Configure Windows Defender SmartScreen" to "Enabled" with "Warn and prevent bypass" selected.

    Windows 11 includes duplicate policies for this setting. It can also be configured under Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Defender SmartScreen >> Explorer.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target

    Description:Microsoft Defender SmartScreen helps protect systems from programs downloaded from the internet that may be malicious. Enabling Microsoft Defender SmartScreen will warn or prevent users from running potentially malicious programs.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Configure Windows SmartScreen' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25339500 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure Windows SmartScreen' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25339500 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
    • name must be equal to 'EnableSmartScreen'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253396 - Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253396r829272_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000215
    Identities:CCI-002824 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-16; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-16)
    Description: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) provides additional protection by performing checks on memory to help prevent malicious code from running. This setting will prevent Data Execution Prevention from being turned off for File Explorer.
    Fix Text:The default behavior is for data execution prevention to be turned on for file explorer.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253396
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000215 - Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.
    Description:Data Execution Prevention (DEP) provides additional protection by performing checks on memory to help prevent malicious code from running. This setting will prevent Data Execution Prevention from being turned off for File Explorer.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25339600 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' is set to 'Disabled' or 'Not Configured'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25339600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoDataExecutionPrevention'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

    V-253398 - File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253398r829278_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000225
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The shell protocol will limit the set of folders applications can open when run in protected mode. Restricting files an application can open, to a limited set of folders, increases the security of Windows.
    Fix Text:The default behavior is for shell protected mode to be turned on for file explorer.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> File Explorer >> "Turn off shell protocol protected mode" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253398
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000225 - File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.
    Description:The shell protocol will limit the set of folders applications can open when run in protected mode. Restricting files an application can open, to a limited set of folders, increases the security of Windows.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Turn off shell protocol protected mode' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25339800 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Turn off shell protocol protected mode' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25339800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'PreXPSP2ShellProtocolBehavior'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000252
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Windows Game Recording and Broadcasting is intended for use with games; however, it could potentially record screen shots of other applications and expose sensitive data. Disabling the feature will prevent this from occurring.

    V-253400 - The use of a hardware security device with Windows Hello for Business must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253400r829284_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000255
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The use of a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) to store keys for Windows Hello for Business provides additional security. Keys stored in the TPM may only be used on that system while keys stored using software are more susceptible to compromise and could be used on other systems.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Hello for Business >> "Use a hardware security device" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253400
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000255 - The use of a hardware security device with Windows Hello for Business must be enabled.
    Description:The use of a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) to store keys for Windows Hello for Business provides additional security. Keys stored in the TPM may only be used on that system while keys stored using software are more susceptible to compromise and could be used on other systems.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Use a hardware security device' is set to 'Enabled' or 'Not Configured')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340000 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Use a hardware security device' is set to 'Enabled' or 'Not Configured'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\PassportForWork'
    • name must be equal to 'RequireSecurityDevice'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'

    V-253401 - Windows 11 must be configured to require a minimum pin length of six characters or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253401r829287_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000260
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Windows allows the use of PINs as well as biometrics for authentication without sending a password to a network or website where it could be compromised. Longer minimum PIN lengths increase the available combinations an attacker would have to attempt. Shorter minimum length significantly reduces the strength.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> PIN Complexity >> "Minimum PIN length" to "6" or greater.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253401
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000260 - Windows 11 must be configured to require a minimum pin length of six characters or greater.
    Description:Windows allows the use of PINs as well as biometrics for authentication without sending a password to a network or website where it could be compromised. Longer minimum PIN lengths increase the available combinations an attacker would have to attempt. Shorter minimum length significantly reduces the strength.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Minimum PIN length' is 6 or greater.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340100 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Minimum PIN length' is 6 or greater.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340100 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\PassportForWork\PINComplexity'
    • name must be equal to 'MinimumPINLength'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25340100 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '6'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253402 - Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253402r829290_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000270
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: Saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client could allow an unauthorized user to establish a remote desktop session to another system. The system must be configured to prevent users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Connection Client >> "Do not allow passwords to be saved" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253402
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000270 - Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client.
    Description:Saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client could allow an unauthorized user to establish a remote desktop session to another system. The system must be configured to prevent users from saving passwords in the Remote Desktop Client.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Do not allow passwords to be saved' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340200 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Do not allow passwords to be saved' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
    • name must be equal to 'DisablePasswordSaving'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253403 - Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253403r829293_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000275
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Preventing users from sharing the local drives on their client computers to Remote Session Hosts that they access helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Device and Resource Redirection >> "Do not allow drive redirection" to "Enabled".

    V-253404 - Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253404r829296_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000280
    Identities:CCI-002038 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-11)
    Description: This setting controls the ability of users to supply passwords automatically as part of their remote desktop connection. Disabling this setting would allow anyone to use the stored credentials in a connection item to connect to the terminal server.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security >> "Always prompt for password upon connection" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253404
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000280 - Remote Desktop Services must always prompt a client for passwords upon connection.
    Description:This setting controls the ability of users to supply passwords automatically as part of their remote desktop connection. Disabling this setting would allow anyone to use the stored credentials in a connection item to connect to the terminal server.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Always prompt for password upon connection' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340400 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Always prompt for password upon connection' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
    • name must be equal to 'fPromptForPassword'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)

    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253405 - The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253405r877394_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000285
    Identities:CCI-001453 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    Description: Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the system to man in the middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man in the middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security "Require secure RPC communication" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253405
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000285 - The Remote Desktop Session Host must require secure RPC communications.
    Description:Allowing unsecure RPC communication exposes the system to man in the middle attacks and data disclosure attacks. A man in the middle attack occurs when an intruder captures packets between a client and server and modifies them before allowing the packets to be exchanged. Usually the attacker will modify the information in the packets in an attempt to cause either the client or server to reveal sensitive information.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340500 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Require secure RPC communication' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340500 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
    • name must be equal to 'fEncryptRPCTraffic'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253406 - Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to the required level.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253406r877398_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000290
    Identities:CCI-000068 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-17 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (2))
    Description: Remote connections must be encrypted to prevent interception of data or sensitive information. Selecting "High Level" will ensure encryption of Remote Desktop Services sessions in both directions.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Remote Desktop Services >> Remote Desktop Session Host >> Security >> "Set client connection encryption level" to "Enabled" and "High Level".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0

    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Set client connection encryption level' is set to 'Enabled' and 'High Level')
    Tests:

    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\Terminal Services'
    • name must be equal to 'MinEncryptionLevel'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000003 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '3'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253408 - Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253408r829308_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000300
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
    Fix Text:The default behavior is for the Windows RSS platform to not use Basic authentication over HTTP connections.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> RSS Feeds >> "Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253408
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000300 - Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used.
    Description:Basic authentication uses plain text passwords that could be used to compromise a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP' is set to 'Not Configured' or 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25340800 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Turn on Basic feed authentication over HTTP' is set to 'Not Configured' or 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25340800 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Feeds'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowBasicAuthInClear'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail

    V-253412 - Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253412r829320_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000320
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Web-based programs may attempt to install malicious software on a system. Ensuring users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software allows them to refuse the installation.
    Fix Text:The default behavior is for Internet Explorer to warn users and select whether to allow or refuse installation when a web-based program attempts to install software on the system.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Installer >> "Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts" to "Not Configured" or "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253412
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000320 - Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
    Description:Web-based programs may attempt to install malicious software on a system. Ensuring users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software allows them to refuse the installation.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts' is set to 'Not Configured' or 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25341200 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts' is set to 'Not Configured' or 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25341200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer'
    • name must be equal to 'SafeForScripting'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'

    V-253413 - Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253413r877377_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000325
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Windows can be configured to automatically sign the user back in after a Windows Update restart. Some protections are in place to help ensure this is done in a secure fashion; however, disabling this will prevent the caching of credentials for this purpose and also ensure the user is aware of the restart.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Logon Options >> "Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253413
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000325 - Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled.
    Description:Windows can be configured to automatically sign the user back in after a Windows Update restart. Some protections are in place to help ensure this is done in a secure fashion; however, disabling this will prevent the caching of credentials for this purpose and also ensure the user is aware of the restart.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (Verifies 'Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25341300 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Verifies 'Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25341300 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System'
    • name must be equal to 'DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253414 - PowerShell script block logging must be enabled on Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253414r829326_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000326
    Identities:CCI-000135 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3 (1).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 (1))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows PowerShell >> "Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253414
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000326 - PowerShell script block logging must be enabled on Windows 11.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling PowerShell script block logging will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25341400 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Turn on PowerShell Script Block Logging' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25341400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ScriptBlockLogging'
    • name must be equal to 'EnableScriptBlockLogging'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253415 - PowerShell Transcription must be enabled on Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253415r829329_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000327
    Identities:CCI-000134 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-3 e)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling PowerShell Transcription will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows PowerShell >> "Turn on PowerShell Transcription" to "Enabled".

    Specify the Transcript output directory to point to a Central Log Server or another secure location to prevent user access.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253415
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000327 - PowerShell Transcription must be enabled on Windows 11.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Enabling PowerShell Transcription will record detailed information from the processing of PowerShell commands and scripts. This can provide additional detail when malware has run on a system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (PowerShell Transcription is enabled on Windows 11)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25341500 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:PowerShell Transcription is enabled on Windows 11
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25341500 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\Transcription'
    • name must be equal to 'EnableTranscripting'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000335
    Identities:CCI-002890 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: MA-4 (6); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: MA-4 (6))

    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Remote Management (WinRM) >> WinRM Client >> "Allow unencrypted traffic" to "Disabled".

    V-253422 - Windows 11 must be configured to prevent Windows apps from being activated by voice while the system is locked.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253422r829350_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000365
    Identities:CCI-000056 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 b; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11.1 (iii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 b)
    Description: Allowing Windows apps to be activated by voice from the lock screen could allow for unauthorized use. Requiring logon will ensure the apps are only used by authorized personnel.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> App Privacy >> "Let Windows apps activate with voice while the system is locked" to "Enabled" with Default for all Apps: set to Force Deny.

    The requirement is NA if the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> App Privacy >> "Let Windows apps activate with voice" is configured to "Enabled" with Default for all Apps: set to Force Deny.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253422
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000365 - Windows 11 must be configured to prevent Windows apps from being activated by voice while the system is locked.
    Description:Allowing Windows apps to be activated by voice from the lock screen could allow for unauthorized use. Requiring logon will ensure the apps are only used by authorized personnel.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Let Windows apps activate with voice' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Default for all Apps' set to 'Force Deny')
        • false ('Let Windows apps activate with voice while the system is locked' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Default for all Apps' set to 'Force Deny')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25342200 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Let Windows apps activate with voice' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Default for all Apps' set to 'Force Deny'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25342200 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppPrivacy'
    • name must be equal to 'LetAppsActivateWithVoice'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000002 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25342201 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Let Windows apps activate with voice while the system is locked' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Default for all Apps' set to 'Force Deny'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25342201 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\AppPrivacy'
    • name must be equal to 'LetAppsActivateWithVoiceAboveLock'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000002 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253423 - The convenience PIN for Windows 11 must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253423r840184_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000370
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: This policy controls whether a domain user can sign in using a convenience PIN to prevent enabling (Password Stuffer).
    Fix Text:Disable the convenience PIN sign-in.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Logon >> Set "Turn on convenience PIN sign-in" to "Disabled".

    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowDomainPINLogon'

    V-253424 - Windows Ink Workspace must be configured to disallow access above the lock.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253424r829356_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-CC-000385
    Identities:CCI-000060 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-11 (1); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-11 (1).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-11 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-11 (1))
    Description: This action secures Windows Ink, which contains applications and features oriented toward pen computing.
    Fix Text:Disable the convenience PIN sign-in.

    To correct this, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Ink Workspace >> Set "Allow Windows Ink Workspace" to "Enabled and set Options "On, but disallow access above lock".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253424
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-CC-000385 - Windows Ink Workspace must be configured to disallow access above the lock.
    Description:This action secures Windows Ink, which contains applications and features oriented toward pen computing.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Allow Windows Ink Workspace' is 'Enabled' with 'Choose one of the following actions' set to 'On, but disallow access above lock')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25342400 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Allow Windows Ink Workspace' is 'Enabled' with 'Choose one of the following actions' set to 'On, but disallow access above lock'
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25342400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\WindowsInkWorkspace'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowWindowsInkWorkspace'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253426 - Windows 11 Kernel (Direct Memory Access) DMA Protection must be enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253426r829362_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-EP-000310
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Kernel DMA Protection to protect PCs against drive-by Direct Memory Access (DMA) attacks using PCI hot plug devices connected to Thunderbolt 3 ports. Drive-by DMA attacks can lead to disclosure of sensitive information residing on a PC, or even injection of malware that allows attackers to bypass the lock screen or control PCs remotely.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Kernel DMA Protection >> "Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection" to "Enabled" with "Enumeration Policy" set to "Block All".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253426
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-EP-000310 - Windows 11 Kernel (Direct Memory Access) DMA Protection must be enabled.
    Description:Kernel DMA Protection to protect PCs against drive-by Direct Memory Access (DMA) attacks using PCI hot plug devices connected to Thunderbolt 3 ports. Drive-by DMA attacks can lead to disclosure of sensitive information residing on a PC, or even injection of malware that allows attackers to bypass the lock screen or control PCs remotely.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Enumeration Policy' set to 'Block All')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25342600 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Enumeration policy for external devices incompatible with Kernel DMA Protection' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Enumeration Policy' set to 'Block All'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25342600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Kernel DMA Protection'
    • name must be equal to 'DeviceEnumerationPolicy'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-253427 - The DoD Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253427r894330_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-PK-000005
    Identities:CCI-000185 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (2) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-5 (2) (b) (1))
    Description: To ensure secure DoD websites and DoD-signed code are properly validated, the system must trust the DoD Root Certificate Authorities (CAs). The DoD root certificates will ensure that the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the DoD CAs.
    Fix Text:Install the DoD Root CA certificates.
    DoD Root CA 3
    DoD Root CA 4
    DoD Root CA 5

    The InstallRoot tool is available on Cyber Exchange at https://cyber.mil/pki-pke/tools-configuration-files. PKI can be found at https://crl.gds.disa.mil/.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11

    Class:compliance

    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)

        • false (The DoD Root CA 5 Certificate expiring 6/14/2041 is installed into the Trusted Root Store.)

    Check:Result is based on check existence only.

    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    Result:false
    Title:The DoD Root CA 4 Certificate expiring 7/25/2032 is installed into the Trusted Root Store.

    Check:Result is based on check existence only.

    V-253428 - The External Root CA certificates must be installed in the Trusted Root Store on unclassified systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253428r894331_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-PK-000010
    Identities:CCI-000185 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (2).1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (2) (a); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-5 (2) (b) (1))
    Description: To ensure secure websites protected with External Certificate Authority (ECA) server certificates are properly validated, the system must trust the ECA Root CAs. The ECA root certificates will ensure the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the External CAs. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
    Fix Text:Install the ECA Root CA certificates on unclassified systems.

    ECA Root CA 4

    The InstallRoot tool is available on Cyber Exchange at https://cyber.mil/pki-pke/tools-configuration-files. PKI can be found at https://crl.gds.disa.mil/.

The ECA root certificates will ensure the trust chain is established for server certificates issued from the External CAs. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
    Class:compliance

    V-253429 - The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253429r894332_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-PK-000015
    Identities:CCI-002470 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-23 (5); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-23 (5))
    Description: To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
    Fix Text:Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.

    Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint
    DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - 49CBE933151872E17C8EAE7F0ABA97FB610F6477

    The certificates can be installed using the InstallRoot tool. The tool and user guide are available on Cyber Exchange at https://cyber.mil/pki-pke/tools-configuration-files. Certificate bundles published by the PKI can be found at https://crl.gds.disa.mil/.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253429
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-PK-000015 - The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
    Description:To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 certificate expiring 11/16/2024 is installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store)

    V-253432 - The built-in administrator account must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253432r829380_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000005
    Identities:CCI-000764 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-2; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-2.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-2; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-2)
    Description: The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. It also provides no accountability to individual administrators on a system. It must be disabled to prevent its use.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Administrator account status" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253432
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000005 - The built-in administrator account must be disabled.
    Description:The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. It also provides no accountability to individual administrators on a system. It must be disabled to prevent its use.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Accounts: Administrator account status' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343200 (user_sid55_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Accounts: Administrator account status' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343200 (user_sid55_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • for user_sid, the following must be true:
      • user_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3524667836-3496280991-2682274133-500'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25343200 (user_sid55_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', enabled must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • user_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3524667836-3496280991-2682274133-500'
    • enabled equals 'false'
    • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    • last_logon equals '1694529237'

    V-253433 - The built-in guest account must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253433r829383_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000010
    Identities:CCI-000804 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-8; NIST SP 800-53A: IA-8.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-8; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: IA-8)
    Description: A system faces an increased vulnerability threat if the built-in guest account is not disabled. This account is a known account that exists on all Windows systems and cannot be deleted. This account is initialized during the installation of the operating system with no password assigned.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Guest account status" to "Disabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253433
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000010 - The built-in guest account must be disabled.
    Description:A system faces an increased vulnerability threat if the built-in guest account is not disabled. This account is a known account that exists on all Windows systems and cannot be deleted. This account is initialized during the installation of the operating system with no password assigned.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (The built-in guest account is disabled.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343300 (user_sid55_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The built-in guest account is disabled.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343300 (user_sid55_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • for user_sid, the following must be true:
      • user_sid must be equal to 'S-1-5-21-3524667836-3496280991-2682274133-501'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000017 (user_sid55_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', enabled must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • user_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3524667836-3496280991-2682274133-501'
    • enabled equals 'false'
    • group_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-546'
    • last_logon equals '0'

    V-253434 - Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253434r829386_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-SO-000015
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies must prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password did exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253434
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-SO-000015 - Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.
    Description:An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies must prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password did exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true ('Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343400 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092810000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-253435 - The built-in administrator account must be renamed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253435r829389_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-SO-000020
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Rename administrator account" to a name other than "Administrator".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253435
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-SO-000020 - The built-in administrator account must be renamed.
    Description:The built-in administrator account is a well-known account subject to attack. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'Administrator' or 'localdomain\Administrator')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343500 (sid_sid_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Accounts: Rename administrator account' is not set to 'Administrator' or 'localdomain\Administrator'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343500 (sid_sid_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • trustee_sid must match the pattern '^S-1-5-[0-9-]+-500$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25343500 (sid_sid_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', trustee_name must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'Administrator'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25343501 (sid_sid_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', trustee_name, the following must be true:
      • trustee_name must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'DESKTOP-QH154P8\Administrator'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-21-3524667836-3496280991-2682274133-500'
    • trustee_name equals 'Administrator'
    • trustee_domain equals 'DESKTOP-QH154P8'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    trustee_name

    V-253436 - The built-in guest account must be renamed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253436r829392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-SO-000025
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The built-in guest account is a well-known user account on all Windows systems and, as initially installed, does not require a password. This can allow access to system resources by unauthorized users. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Rename guest account" to a name other than "Guest".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253436
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-SO-000025 - The built-in guest account must be renamed.
    Description:The built-in guest account is a well-known user account on all Windows systems and, as initially installed, does not require a password. This can allow access to system resources by unauthorized users. Renaming this account to an unidentified name improves the protection of this account and the system.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Accounts: Rename Guest account' is not set to 'Guest' or 'localdomain\Guest')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25343600 (sid_sid_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Accounts: Rename Guest account' is not set to 'Guest' or 'localdomain\Guest'
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:All item-state comparisons must be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25343600 (sid_sid_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • trustee_sid must match the pattern '^S-1-5-[0-9-]+-501$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25343600 (sid_sid_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', trustee_name must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'Guest'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25343601 (sid_sid_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', trustee_name, the following must be true:
