    V-253491 - The "Deny access to this computer from the network" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253491r829557_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-UR-000070
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny access to this computer from the network" right defines the accounts that are prevented from logging on from the network.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    Local accounts on domain-joined systems must also be assigned this right to decrease the risk of lateral movement resulting from credential theft attacks.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Deny access to this computer from the network" to include the following:

    Domain Systems Only:
    Enterprise Admins group
    Domain Admins group
    Local account (see Note below)

    All Systems:
    Guests group

    Privileged Access Workstations (PAWs) dedicated to the management of Active Directory are exempt from denying the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups. (See the Windows Privileged Access Workstation STIG for PAW requirements.)

    Note: "Local account" is a built-in security group used to assign user rights and permissions to all local accounts.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253491
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-UR-000070 - The "Deny access to this computer from the network" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny access to this computer from the network" right defines the accounts that are prevented from logging on from the network.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    Local accounts on domain-joined systems must also be assigned this right to decrease the risk of lateral movement resulting from credential theft attacks.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Admins)
            • false (Deny access to this computer from the network - Enterprise Admins)
            • false (Deny access to this computer from the network - Local account)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (The system is a Windows Domain Member Workstation)
          • true (All child checks must be true.)
            • true (The system is a Windows Standalone Workstation)
        • false (Deny access to this computer from the network - Guests)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349101 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Deny access to this computer from the network - Domain Admins
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000003 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(.+\\)?Domain Admins$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sedenynetworklogonright must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '1' for:
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '0' for
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349102 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Deny access to this computer from the network - Enterprise Admins
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000004 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(.+\\)?Enterprise Admins$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sedenynetworklogonright must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '1' for:
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '0' for
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349103 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Deny access to this computer from the network - Local account
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000007 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(NT AUTHORITY\\)?Local account$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sedenynetworklogonright must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '1' for:
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '0' for
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:10000200 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:The system is a Windows Domain Member Workstation
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:10000100 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM win32_computersystem'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:10000200 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all domainrole must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM win32_computersystem'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • domainrole = '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:10000100 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The system is a Windows Standalone Workstation
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:10000100 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT DomainRole FROM win32_computersystem'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:10000100 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • all domainrole must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT DomainRole FROM win32_computersystem'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • domainrole = '0'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349100 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Deny access to this computer from the network - Guests
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000006 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must be equal (case insensitive) to 'Guests'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349100 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', sedenynetworklogonright must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '1' for:
    • sedenynetworklogonright equals '0' for Guests
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    sedenynetworklogonright

    V-253494 - The "Deny log on locally" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253494r829566_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-UR-000085
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny log on locally" right defines accounts that are prevented from logging on interactively.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Deny log on locally" to include the following:

    Domain Systems Only:
    Enterprise Admins Group
    Domain Admins Group

    Privileged Access Workstations (PAWs) dedicated to the management of Active Directory are exempt from denying the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups. (See the Windows Privileged Access Workstation STIG for PAW requirements.)

    All Systems:
    Guests Group
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253494
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-UR-000085 - The "Deny log on locally" user right on workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny log on locally" right defines accounts that are prevented from logging on interactively.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
          • false (All child checks must be true.)
            • false (Deny log on locally - Domain Admins)
            • false (Deny log on as a locally - Enterprise Admins)
          • true (System is not a member of a domain)
        • false (Deny log on locally - Guests)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349402 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Deny log on locally - Domain Admins
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).

    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(.+\\)?Domain Admins$'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349400 (accesstoken_state)

    [ false ]

    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349403 (accesstoken_test)

    sedenyinteractivelogonright

    V-253495 - The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" user right on Windows 11 workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253495r829569_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-UR-000090
    Identities:CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    CCI-002314 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-17 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-17 (1))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" right defines the accounts that are prevented from logging on using Remote Desktop Services.

    If Remote Desktop Services is not used by the organization, the Everyone group must be assigned this right to prevent all access.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    Local accounts on domain-joined systems must also be assigned this right to decrease the risk of lateral movement resulting from credential theft attacks.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" to include the following:

    If Remote Desktop Services is not used by the organization, assign the Everyone group this right to prevent all access.

    Domain Systems Only:
    Enterprise Admins group
    Domain Admins group
    Local account (see Note below)

    All Systems:
    Guests group

    Privileged Access Workstations (PAWs) dedicated to the management of Active Directory are exempt from denying the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups. (See the Windows Privileged Access Workstation STIG for PAW requirements.)

    Note: "Local account" is a built-in security group used to assign user rights and permissions to all local accounts.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253495
    Result:false
    Title:WN11-UR-000090 - The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" user right on Windows 11 workstations must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and unauthenticated access on all systems.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" right defines the accounts that are prevented from logging on using Remote Desktop Services.

    If Remote Desktop Services is not used by the organization, the Everyone group must be assigned this right to prevent all access.

    In an Active Directory Domain, denying logons to the Enterprise Admins and Domain Admins groups on lower trust systems helps mitigate the risk of privilege escalation from credential theft attacks, which could lead to the compromise of an entire domain.

    Local accounts on domain-joined systems must also be assigned this right to decrease the risk of lateral movement resulting from credential theft attacks.

    The Guests group must be assigned this right to prevent unauthenticated access.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • false (All child checks must be true.)
              • false (Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Domain Admins)
              • false (Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Enterprise Admins)
              • false (Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Local account)
              • false (System is a Windows non-DC domain-joined system)
            • true (The system is a Windows Standalone Workstation or Server)
          • false (Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Guests)
        • false (Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services - Everyone)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349501 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:At least one collected item must match the given state(s).

    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(.+\\)?Domain Admins$'

    [ false ]

    • sedenyremoteInteractivelogonright equals '0' for
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349502 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:false

    • security_principle must match the pattern '^(?i)(.+\\)?Enterprise Admins$'

    V-253496 - The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253496r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000095
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right allows the "Trusted for Delegation" setting to be changed. This could potentially allow unauthorized users to impersonate other users.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253496
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-UR-000095 - The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right allows the "Trusted for Delegation" setting to be changed. This could potentially allow unauthorized users to impersonate other users.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation - None)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349600 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation - None
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000008 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • security_principle must match the pattern '.+'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349600 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', seenabledelegationprivilege must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • seenabledelegationprivilege equals '1' for:
    • seenabledelegationprivilege equals '0' for Access Control Assistance Operators, Administrators, Backup Operators, Cryptographic Operators, Device Owners, Distributed COM Users, Event Log Readers, Guests, Hyper-V Administrators, IIS_IUSRS, Network Configuration Operators, Performance Log Users, Performance Monitor Users, Power Users, Remote Desktop Users, Remote Management Users, Replicator, System Managed Accounts Group, Users, Administrator, DefaultAccount, Guest, DESKTOP-QH154P8\rick, WDAGUtilityAccount, NETWORK SERVICE, LOCAL SERVICE, SYSTEM, IUSR, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Authenticated Users, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, PROXY, ANONYMOUS LOGON, SERVICE, INTERACTIVE, BATCH, NETWORK, DIALUP, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, CREATOR GROUP, CREATOR OWNER, Everyone, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES, Window Manager\Window Manager Group

    V-253497 - The "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253497r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000100
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right can remotely shut down a system which could result in a DoS.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Force shutdown from a remote system" to only include the following groups or accounts:

    Administrators
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11

    Result:true

    Accounts with the "Force shutdown from a remote system" user right can remotely shut down a system which could result in a DoS.

    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'Administrators'

    V-253498 - The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253498r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000110
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf. An attacker could potentially use this to elevate privileges.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Impersonate a client after authentication" to only include the following groups or accounts:

    Administrators
    LOCAL SERVICE
    NETWORK SERVICE
    SERVICE
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253498
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-UR-000110 - The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Impersonate a client after authentication" user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf. An attacker could potentially use this to elevate privileges.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (No groups or accounts are granted the 'Impersonate a client after authentication' user right.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349800 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:No groups or accounts are granted the 'Impersonate a client after authentication' user right.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000013 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'Administrators'
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'LOCAL SERVICE'
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'NETWORK SERVICE'
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'SERVICE'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349800 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', seimpersonateprivilege must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • seimpersonateprivilege equals '1' for:
    • seimpersonateprivilege equals '0' for Network Configuration Operators, ANONYMOUS LOGON, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, Replicator, Power Users, BATCH, Distributed COM Users, INTERACTIVE, Performance Monitor Users, Window Manager\Window Manager Group, Everyone, Authenticated Users, Guest, Remote Desktop Users, NETWORK, System Managed Accounts Group, IIS_IUSRS, DIALUP, Users, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, CREATOR GROUP, SYSTEM, DefaultAccount, WDAGUtilityAccount, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, Cryptographic Operators, Event Log Readers, Remote Management Users, CREATOR OWNER, Backup Operators, DESKTOP-QH154P8\rick, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, IUSR, Performance Log Users, Device Owners, PROXY, Guests, Administrator, Access Control Assistance Operators, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Hyper-V Administrators

    V-253499 - The "Load and unload device drivers" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253499r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000120
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Load and unload device drivers" user right allows device drivers to dynamically be loaded on a system by a user. This could potentially be used to install malicious code by an attacker.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Load and unload device drivers" to only include the following groups or accounts:

    Administrators
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:253499
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-UR-000120 - The "Load and unload device drivers" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
    Description:Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Load and unload device drivers" user right allows device drivers to dynamically be loaded on a system by a user. This could potentially be used to install malicious code by an attacker.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Load and unload device drivers - Administrators)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25349900 (accesstoken_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Load and unload device drivers - Administrators
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000009 (accesstoken_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • security_principle equals (case insensitive) 'Administrators'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25349900 (accesstoken_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', seloaddriverprivilege must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • seloaddriverprivilege equals '1' for:
    • seloaddriverprivilege equals '0' for LOCAL SERVICE, Network Configuration Operators, ENTERPRISE DOMAIN CONTROLLERS, Replicator, Power Users, Distributed COM Users, Performance Monitor Users, Guest, Remote Desktop Users, NETWORK, System Managed Accounts Group, DIALUP, Administrator, TERMINAL SERVER USER, Hyper-V Administrators, ANONYMOUS LOGON, NT SERVICE\ALL SERVICES, BATCH, INTERACTIVE, Window Manager\Window Manager Group, Everyone, Authenticated Users, IIS_IUSRS, Users, CREATOR GROUP, NT SERVICE\WdiServiceHost, WDAGUtilityAccount, DefaultAccount, SYSTEM, Event Log Readers, Cryptographic Operators, CREATOR GROUP SERVER, Remote Management Users, CREATOR OWNER, Backup Operators, SERVICE, DESKTOP-QH154P8\rick, CREATOR OWNER SERVER, Device Owners, Performance Log Users, IUSR, NETWORK SERVICE, PROXY, Guests, Access Control Assistance Operators

    V-253500 - The "Lock pages in memory" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253500r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000125
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    The "Lock pages in memory" user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a DoS.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> "Lock pages in memory" to be defined but containing no entries (blank).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:

    Result:true

    The "Lock pages in memory" user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a DoS.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253501r829587_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-UR-000130

    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Manage auditing and security log" user right can manage the security log and change auditing configurations. This could be used to clear evidence of tampering.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253505r877392_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN11-UR-000160
    Identities:CCI-002235 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (10); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (10))
    Description: Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

    Accounts with the "Restore files and directories" user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data. It could also be used to over-write more current data.
