    V-256893 - Internet Explorer must be disabled for Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-256893r892440_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN11-CC-000391
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) is not supported on Windows 11 semi-annual channel.
    Fix Text:For Windows 11 semi-annual channel, remove or disable the IE11 application.

    To disable IE11 as a standalone browser:

    Set the policy value for "Computer Configuration/Administrative Templates/Windows Components/Internet Explorer/Disable Internet Explorer 11 as a standalone browser" to "Enabled" with the option value set to "Never".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows11:def:256893
    Result:true
    Title:WN11-CC-000391 - Internet Explorer must be disabled for Windows 11.
    Description:Internet Explorer 11 (IE11) is not supported on Windows 11 semi-annual channel.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
            • true (64-bit Microsoft Edge is installed) (negated)
            • false (32-bit Microsoft Edge is installed) (negated)
          • false (Internet Explorer 11 is disabled as a standalone browser)
        • true (Internet Explorer 11 optional feature disabled or not installed)
        • false (The OS is Windows Enterprise LTSC)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.edge:tst:100 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:64-bit Microsoft Edge is installed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.edge:obj:102 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Include Items If:
    • value equals 'Microsoft Edge'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\Microsoft Edge'
    • name equals 'DisplayName'
    • last_write_time equals '133402700400000000'
    • type equals 'reg_sz'
    • value equals 'Microsoft Edge'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.edge:tst:101 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:32-bit Microsoft Edge is installed
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.edge:obj:103 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Include Items If:
    • value equals 'Microsoft Edge'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25689301 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Internet Explorer 11 is disabled as a standalone browser
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25689301 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\Main'
    • name must be equal to 'NotifyDisableIEOptions'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000002 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '2'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25689300 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Internet Explorer 11 optional feature disabled or not installed
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25689300 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'Internet-Explorer-Optional-amd64''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000020 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'Internet-Explorer-Optional-amd64''
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:22070601 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:The OS is Windows Enterprise LTSC
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25325400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name must be equal (case insensitive) to 'EditionId'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:22070602 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to 'EnterpriseS'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name equals 'EditionId'
    • last_write_time equals '133404092850000000'
    • type equals 'reg_sz'
    • value equals 'Professional'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    value

    V-253255 - Windows 11 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253255r877465_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000010
    Identities:CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (1))
    Description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect information that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. There are a number of system requirements that must be met in order for Credential Guard to be configured and enabled properly. Without a TPM enabled and ready for use, Credential Guard keys are stored in a less secure method using software.
    Fix Text:For standalone systems, this is NA.

    Virtualization-based security, including Credential Guard, currently cannot be implemented in virtual desktop implementations (VDI) due to specific supporting requirements including a TPM, UEFI with Secure Boot, and the capability to run the Hyper-V feature within the virtual desktop.

    For VDIs where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    Ensure domain-joined systems must have a TPM that is configured for use. (Versions 2.0 support Credential Guard.)

    The TPM must be enabled in the firmware.
    Run "tpm.msc" for configuration options in Windows.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to protect information that could be used in credential theft attacks if compromised. There are a number of system requirements that must be met in order for Credential Guard to be configured and enabled properly. Without a TPM enabled and ready for use, Credential Guard keys are stored in a less secure method using software.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:21
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Windows 11 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253255, SV-253255r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253255, SV-253255r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:21
    Question:Verify domain-joined systems have a TPM enabled and ready for use.

    For standalone systems, this is NA.

    Virtualization-based security, including Credential Guard, currently cannot be implemented in virtual desktop implementations (VDI) due to specific supporting requirements including a TPM, UEFI with Secure Boot, and the capability to run the Hyper-V feature within the virtual desktop.

    For VDIs where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    Verify the system has a TPM and is ready for use.
    Run "tpm.msc".
    Review the sections in the center pane.
    "Status" must indicate it has been configured with a message such as "The TPM is ready for use" or "The TPM is on and ownership has been taken".
    TPM Manufacturer Information - Specific Version = 2.0

    If a TPM is not found or is not ready for use, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-002421
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253256 - Windows 11 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253256r877465_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000015
    Identities:CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (1))
    Description: UEFI provides additional security features in comparison to legacy BIOS firmware, including Secure Boot. UEFI is required to support additional security features in Windows 11, including virtualization-based Security and Credential Guard. Systems with UEFI that are operating in Legacy BIOS mode will not support these security features.
    Fix Text:Configure UEFI firmware to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS mode.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: UEFI provides additional security features in comparison to legacy BIOS firmware, including Secure Boot. UEFI is required to support additional security features in Windows 11, including virtualization-based Security and Credential Guard. Systems with UEFI that are operating in Legacy BIOS mode will not support these security features.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:41
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Windows 11 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253256, SV-253256r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253256, SV-253256r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:41
    Question:For virtual desktop implementations (VDIs) where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    Verify the system firmware is configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS.

    Run "System Information".

    Under "System Summary", if "BIOS Mode" does not display "UEFI", this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-002421
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253257 - Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows 11 systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253257r877465_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000020
    Identities:CCI-002421 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-8 (1); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-8 (1))
    Description: Secure Boot is a standard that ensures systems boot only to a trusted operating system. Secure Boot is required to support additional security features in Windows 11, including virtualization-based Security and Credential Guard. If Secure Boot is turned off, these security features will not function.
    Fix Text:Enable Secure Boot in the system firmware.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Secure Boot is a standard that ensures systems boot only to a trusted operating system. Secure Boot is required to support additional security features in Windows 11, including virtualization-based Security and Credential Guard. If Secure Boot is turned off, these security features will not function.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:61
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows 11 systems.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253257, SV-253257r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253257, SV-253257r877465, SRG-OS-000424-GPOS-00188
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:61
    Question:Verify the system firmware is configured for Secure Boot.

    For virtual desktop implementations (VDIs) where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, this is NA.

    Run "System Information".

    Under "System Summary", if "Secure Boot State" does not display "On", this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-002421
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253258 - Windows 11 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where ESS is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP).

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253258r828858_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000025
    Identities:CCI-001233 (NIST SP 800-53: SI-2 (2); NIST SP 800-53A: SI-2 (2).1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SI-2 (2))
    Description: An approved tool for continuous network scanning must be installed and configured to run.

    Without the use of automated mechanisms to scan for security flaws on a continuous and/or periodic basis, the operating system or other system components may remain vulnerable to the exploits presented by undetected software flaws.

    To support this requirement, the operating system may have an integrated solution incorporating continuous scanning using ESS and periodic scanning using other tools, as specified in the requirement.
    Fix Text:Install DoD-approved ESS software and ensure it is operating continuously.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: An approved tool for continuous network scanning must be installed and configured to run. Without the use of automated mechanisms to scan for security flaws on a continuous and/or periodic basis, the operating system or other system components may remain vulnerable to the exploits presented by undetected software flaws. To support this requirement, the operating system may have an integrated solution incorporating continuous scanning using ESS and periodic scanning using other tools, as specified in the requirement.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:81
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Windows 11 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where ESS is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP).
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253258, SV-253258r828858, SRG-OS-000191-GPOS-00080)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253258, SV-253258r828858, SRG-OS-000191-GPOS-00080
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:81
    Question:Verify DoD-approved ESS software is installed and properly operating. Ask the site ISSM for documentation of the ESS software installation and configuration.

    If the ISSM is not able to provide a documented configuration for an installed ESS or if the ESS software is not properly maintained or used, this is a finding.

    Note: Example of documentation can be a copy of the site's CCB approved Software Baseline with version of software noted or a memo from the ISSM stating current ESS software and version.

    References:
    CCI-001233
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253262 - The operating system must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253262r890447_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000035
    Identities:CCI-001774 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (5) (b); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (5) (b))
    Description: Utilizing an allowlist provides a configuration management method for allowing the execution of only authorized software. Using only authorized software decreases risk by limiting the number of potential vulnerabilities.

    The organization must identify authorized software programs and only permit execution of authorized software. The process used to identify software programs that are authorized to execute on organizational information systems is commonly referred to as allowlisting.
    Fix Text:Configure an application allowlisting program to employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.

    Configuration of allowlisting applications will vary by the program. AppLocker is an allowlisting application built into Windows 11 Enterprise.

    If AppLocker is used, it is configured through group policy in Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Application Control Policies >> AppLocker.

    Implementation guidance for AppLocker is available in the NSA paper "Application allowlisting using Microsoft AppLocker" at the following link:

    https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/windows-defender-application-control/applocker/applocker-policies-deployment-guide
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Utilizing an allowlist provides a configuration management method for allowing the execution of only authorized software. Using only authorized software decreases risk by limiting the number of potential vulnerabilities. The organization must identify authorized software programs and only permit execution of authorized software. The process used to identify software programs that are authorized to execute on organizational information systems is commonly referred to as allowlisting.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:161
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The operating system must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253262, SV-253262r890447, SRG-OS-000370-GPOS-00155)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253262, SV-253262r890447, SRG-OS-000370-GPOS-00155
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:161
    Question:This is applicable to unclassified systems.

    Verify the operating system employs a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs. This must include packaged apps such as the universal apps installed by default on systems.

    If an application allowlisting program is not in use on the system, this is a finding.

    Configuration of allowlisting applications will vary by the program.

    AppLocker is an allowlisting application built into Windows 11 Enterprise. A deny-by-default implementation is initiated by enabling any AppLocker rules within a category, only allowing what is specified by defined rules.

    If AppLocker is used, perform the following to view the configuration of AppLocker:
    Run "PowerShell".

    Execute the following command, substituting [c:\temp\file.xml] with a location and file name appropriate for the system:
    Get-AppLockerPolicy -Effective -XML > c:\temp\file.xml

    This will produce an xml file with the effective settings that can be viewed in a browser or opened in a program such as Excel for review.

    Implementation guidance for AppLocker is available at the following link:

    https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/windows-defender-application-control/applocker/applocker-policies-deployment-guide

    References:
    CCI-001774
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253266 - Alternate operating systems must not be permitted on the same system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253266r828882_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000055
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Allowing other operating systems to run on a secure system may allow security to be circumvented.
    Fix Text:Ensure Windows 11 is the only operating system on a device. Remove alternate operating systems.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Allowing other operating systems to run on a secure system may allow security to be circumvented.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:241
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Alternate operating systems must not be permitted on the same system.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253266, SV-253266r828882, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253266, SV-253266r828882, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:241
    Question:Verify the system does not include other operating system installations.

    Run "Advanced System Settings".
    Select the "Advanced" tab.
    Click the "Settings" button in the "Startup and Recovery" section.

    If the drop-down list box "Default operating system:" shows any operating system other than Windows 11, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253267 - Non-system-created file shares on a system must limit access to groups that require it.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253267r828885_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000060
    Identities:CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Shares which provide network access, must not exist on a workstation except for system-created administrative shares, and could potentially expose sensitive information. If a share is necessary, share permissions, as well as NTFS permissions, must be reconfigured to give the minimum access to those accounts that require it.
    Fix Text:If a non-system-created share is required on a system, configure the share and NTFS permissions to limit access to the specific groups or accounts that require it.

    Remove any unnecessary non-system-created shares.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Shares which provide network access, must not exist on a workstation except for system-created administrative shares, and could potentially expose sensitive information. If a share is necessary, share permissions, as well as NTFS permissions, must be reconfigured to give the minimum access to those accounts that require it.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:261
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Non-system-created file shares on a system must limit access to groups that require it.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253267, SV-253267r828885, SRG-OS-000138-GPOS-00069)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253267, SV-253267r828885, SRG-OS-000138-GPOS-00069
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:261
    Question:Non-system-created shares must not exist on workstations.

    If only system-created shares exist on the system, this is NA.

    Run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Shared Folders >> Shares.

    If the only shares listed are "ADMIN$", "C$" and "IPC$", this is NA.
    (Selecting Properties for system-created shares will display a message that it has been shared for administrative purposes.)

    Right-click any non-system-created shares.
    Select "Properties".
    Select the "Share Permissions" tab.

    Verify the necessity of any shares found.
    If the file shares have not been reconfigured to restrict permissions to the specific groups or accounts that require access, this is a finding.

    Select the "Security" tab.

    If the NTFS permissions have not been reconfigured to restrict permissions to the specific groups or accounts that require access, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-001090
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253270 - Only accounts responsible for the backup operations must be members of the Backup Operators group.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253270r828894_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000075
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Backup Operators are able to read and write to any file in the system, regardless of the rights assigned to it. Backup and restore rights permit users to circumvent the file access restrictions present on NTFS disk drives for backup and restore purposes. Members of the Backup Operators group must have separate logon accounts for performing backup duties.
    Fix Text:Create separate accounts for backup operations for users with this privilege.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Backup Operators are able to read and write to any file in the system, regardless of the rights assigned to it. Backup and restore rights permit users to circumvent the file access restrictions present on NTFS disk drives for backup and restore purposes. Members of the Backup Operators group must have separate logon accounts for performing backup duties.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:321
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Only accounts responsible for the backup operations must be members of the Backup Operators group.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253270, SV-253270r828894, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253270, SV-253270r828894, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:321
    Question:Run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Groups.
    Review the members of the Backup Operators group.

    If the group contains no accounts, this is not a finding.

    If the group contains any accounts, the accounts must be specifically for backup functions.

    If the group contains any standard user accounts used for performing normal user tasks, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253271 - Only authorized user accounts must be allowed to create or run virtual machines on Windows 11 systems.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253271r828897_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000080
    Identities:CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    Description: Allowing other operating systems to run on a secure system may allow users to circumvent security. For Hyper-V, preventing unauthorized users from being assigned to the Hyper-V Administrators group will prevent them from accessing or creating virtual machines on the system. The Hyper-V Hypervisor is used by virtualization-based Security features such as Credential Guard on Windows 11; however, it is not the full Hyper-V installation.
    Fix Text:For Hyper-V, remove any unauthorized groups or user accounts from the "Hyper-V Administrators" group.

    For hosted hypervisors other than Hyper-V, restrict access to create or run virtual machines to authorized user accounts only.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Allowing other operating systems to run on a secure system may allow users to circumvent security. For Hyper-V, preventing unauthorized users from being assigned to the Hyper-V Administrators group will prevent them from accessing or creating virtual machines on the system. The Hyper-V Hypervisor is used by virtualization-based Security features such as Credential Guard on Windows 11; however, it is not the full Hyper-V installation.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:341
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Only authorized user accounts must be allowed to create or run virtual machines on Windows 11 systems.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253271, SV-253271r828897, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00124)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253271, SV-253271r828897, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00124
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:341
    Question:If a hosted hypervisor (Hyper-V, VMware Workstation, etc.) is installed on the system, verify only authorized user accounts are allowed to run virtual machines.

    For Hyper-V, run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Groups.
    Double click on "Hyper-V Administrators".

    If any unauthorized groups or user accounts are listed in "Members:", this is a finding.

    For hosted hypervisors other than Hyper-V, verify only authorized user accounts have access to run the virtual machines. Restrictions may be enforced by access to the physical system, software restriction policies, or access restrictions built into the application.

    If any unauthorized groups or user accounts have access to create or run virtual machines, this is a finding.

    All users authorized to create or run virtual machines must be documented with the ISSM/ISSO. Accounts nested within group accounts must be documented as individual accounts and not the group accounts.

    References:
    CCI-002165
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253273 - Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253273r828903_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000090
    Identities:CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: Passwords that do not expire increase exposure with a greater probability of being discovered or cracked.
    Fix Text:Configure all passwords to expire.
    Run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Users.
    Double-click each active account.
    Ensure "Password never expires" is not checked on all active accounts.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Passwords that do not expire increase exposure with a greater probability of being discovered or cracked.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:381
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Accounts must be configured to require password expiration.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253273, SV-253273r828903, SRG-OS-000076-GPOS-00044)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253273, SV-253273r828903, SRG-OS-000076-GPOS-00044
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:381
    Question:Run "Computer Management".
    Navigate to System Tools >> Local Users and Groups >> Users.
    Double-click each active account.

    If "Password never expires" is selected for any account, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000199
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253274 - Permissions for system files and directories must conform to minimum requirements.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253274r840169_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000095
    Identities:CCI-002165 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3 (4))
    Description: Changing the system's file and directory permissions allows the possibility of unauthorized and anonymous modification to the operating system and installed applications.
    Fix Text:Maintain the default file system permissions and configure the Security Option: "Network access: Let everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" to "Disabled" (WN11-SO-000160).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Changing the system's file and directory permissions allows the possibility of unauthorized and anonymous modification to the operating system and installed applications.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:401
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Permissions for system files and directories must conform to minimum requirements.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253274, SV-253274r840169, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00122)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253274, SV-253274r840169, SRG-OS-000312-GPOS-00122
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:401
    Question:The default file system permissions are adequate when the Security Option "Network access: Let Everyone permissions apply to anonymous users" is set to "Disabled" (WN11-SO-000160).

    If the default file system permissions are maintained and the referenced option is set to "Disabled", this is not a finding.

    Verify the default permissions for the sample directories below. Non-privileged groups such as Users or Authenticated Users must not have greater than read & execute permissions except where noted as defaults. (Individual accounts must not be used to assign permissions.)

    Viewing in File Explorer:
    Select the "Security" tab, and the "Advanced" button.

    C:\
    Type - "Allow" for all
    Inherited from - "None" for all
    Principal - Access - Applies to
    Administrators - Full control - This folder, subfolders, and files
    SYSTEM - Full control - This folder, subfolders, and files
    Users - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files
    Authenticated Users - Modify - Subfolders and files only
    Authenticated Users - Create folders / append data - This folder only

    \Program Files
    Type - "Allow" for all
    Inherited from - "None" for all
    Principal - Access - Applies to
    TrustedInstaller - Full control - This folder and subfolders
    SYSTEM - Modify - This folder only
    SYSTEM - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    Administrators - Modify - This folder only
    Administrators - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    Users - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files
    CREATOR OWNER - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files
    ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files

    \Windows
    Type - "Allow" for all
    Inherited from - "None" for all
    Principal - Access - Applies to
    TrustedInstaller - Full control - This folder and subfolders
    SYSTEM - Modify - This folder only
    SYSTEM - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    Administrators - Modify - This folder only
    Administrators - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    Users - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files
    CREATOR OWNER - Full control - Subfolders and files only
    ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files
    ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & execute - This folder, subfolders, and files

    Alternately use icacls.

    Run "CMD" as administrator.
    Enter "icacls" followed by the directory.

    icacls c:\
    icacls "c:\program files"
    icacls c:\windows

    The following results will be displayed as each is entered:

    c:\
    BUILTIN\Administrators:(OI)(CI)(F)
    NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM:(OI)(CI)(F)
    BUILTIN\Users:(OI)(CI)(RX)
    NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users:(OI)(CI)(IO)(M)
    NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users:(AD)
    Mandatory Label\High Mandatory Level:(OI)(NP)(IO)(NW)
    Successfully processed 1 files; Failed processing 0 files

    c:\program files
    NT SERVICE\TrustedInstaller:(F)
    NT SERVICE\TrustedInstaller:(CI)(IO)(F)
    NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM:(M)
    NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    BUILTIN\Administrators:(M)
    BUILTIN\Administrators:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    BUILTIN\Users:(RX)
    BUILTIN\Users:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    CREATOR OWNER:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES:(RX)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES:(RX)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    Successfully processed 1 files; Failed processing 0 files

    c:\windows
    NT SERVICE\TrustedInstaller:(F)
    NT SERVICE\TrustedInstaller:(CI)(IO)(F)
    NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM:(M)
    NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    BUILTIN\Administrators:(M)
    BUILTIN\Administrators:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    BUILTIN\Users:(RX)
    BUILTIN\Users:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    CREATOR OWNER:(OI)(CI)(IO)(F)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES:(RX)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES:(RX)
    APPLICATION PACKAGE AUTHORITY\ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES:(OI)(CI)(IO)(GR,GE)
    Successfully processed 1 files; Failed processing 0 files

    References:
    CCI-002165
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253280 - Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253280r828924_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000130
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Use of software certificates and their accompanying installation files for end users to access resources is less secure than the use of hardware-based certificates.
    Fix Text:Remove any certificate installation files (*.p12 and *.pfx) found on a system.

    Note: This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for .p12 certificate files (e.g., Oracle Wallet Manager) or Adobe PreFlight certificate files.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Use of software certificates and their accompanying installation files for end users to access resources is less secure than the use of hardware-based certificates.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:521
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 11.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253280, SV-253280r828924, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253280, SV-253280r828924, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:521
    Question:Search all drives for *.p12 and *.pfx files.

    If any files with these extensions exist, this is a finding.

    This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for .p12 certificate files (e.g., Oracle Wallet Manager) or Adobe PreFlight certificate files. Some applications create files with extensions of .p12 that are not certificate installation files. Removal of non-certificate installation files from systems is not required. These must be documented with the ISSO.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253281 - A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253281r828927_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000135
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: A firewall provides a line of defense against attack, allowing or blocking inbound and outbound connections based on a set of rules.
    Fix Text:Install and enable a host-based firewall on the system.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: A firewall provides a line of defense against attack, allowing or blocking inbound and outbound connections based on a set of rules.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:541
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253281, SV-253281r828927, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253281, SV-253281r828927, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:541
    Question:Determine if a host-based firewall is installed and enabled on the system. If a host-based firewall is not installed and enabled on the system, this is a finding.

    The configuration requirements will be determined by the applicable firewall STIG.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253282 - Inbound exceptions to the firewall on Windows 11 domain workstations must only allow authorized remote management hosts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253282r828930_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000140
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Allowing inbound access to domain workstations from other systems may allow lateral movement across systems if credentials are compromised. Limiting inbound connections only from authorized remote management systems will help limit this exposure.
    Fix Text:Configure firewall exceptions to inbound connections on domain workstations to include only authorized remote management hosts.

    Configure only inbound connection exceptions for authorized remote management hosts.
    Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Inbound Rules (this link will be in the right pane)

    For any inbound rules that allow connections, configure the Scope for Remote IP address to those of authorized remote management hosts. This may be defined as an IP address, subnet or range. Apply the rule to all firewall profiles.

    If a third-party firewall is used, configure inbound exceptions to only include authorized remote management hosts.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Allowing inbound access to domain workstations from other systems may allow lateral movement across systems if credentials are compromised. Limiting inbound connections only from authorized remote management systems will help limit this exposure.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:561
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Inbound exceptions to the firewall on Windows 11 domain workstations must only allow authorized remote management hosts.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253282, SV-253282r828930, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00232)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253282, SV-253282r828930, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00232
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:561
    Question:Verify firewall exceptions to inbound connections on domain workstations include only authorized remote management hosts.

    If allowed inbound exceptions are not limited to authorized remote management hosts, this is a finding.

    Review inbound firewall exceptions.
    Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Windows Defender Firewall with Advanced Security >> Inbound Rules (this link will be in the right pane)

    For any inbound rules that allow connections view the Scope for Remote IP address. This may be defined as an IP address, subnet, or range. The rule must apply to all firewall profiles.

    If a third-party firewall is used, ensure comparable settings are in place.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253290 - Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 11.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253290r828954_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000190
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Accounts or groups given rights on a system may show up as unresolved SIDs for various reasons including deletion of the accounts or groups. If the account or group objects are reanimated, there is a potential they may still have rights no longer intended. Valid domain accounts or groups may also show up as unresolved SIDs if a connection to the domain cannot be established for some reason.
    Fix Text:Remove any unresolved SIDs found in User Rights assignments and determined to not be for currently valid accounts or groups by removing the accounts or groups from the appropriate group policy.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Accounts or groups given rights on a system may show up as unresolved SIDs for various reasons including deletion of the accounts or groups. If the account or group objects are reanimated, there is a potential they may still have rights no longer intended. Valid domain accounts or groups may also show up as unresolved SIDs if a connection to the domain cannot be established for some reason.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:721
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 11.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253290, SV-253290r828954, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253290, SV-253290r828954, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:721
    Question:Review the effective User Rights setting in Local Group Policy Editor.
    Run "gpedit.msc".

    Navigate to Local Computer Policy >> Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment.

    Review each User Right listed for any unresolved SIDs to determine whether they are valid, such as due to being temporarily disconnected from the domain. (Unresolved SIDs have the format of "*S-1-..".)

    If any unresolved SIDs exist and are not for currently valid accounts or groups, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253291 - Bluetooth must be turned off unless approved by the organization.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253291r828957_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000210
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: If not configured properly, Bluetooth may allow rogue devices to communicate with a system. If a rogue device is paired with a system, there is potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
    Fix Text:Turn off Bluetooth radios not organizationally approved. Establish an organizational policy for the use of Bluetooth.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: If not configured properly, Bluetooth may allow rogue devices to communicate with a system. If a rogue device is paired with a system, there is potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:741
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Bluetooth must be turned off unless approved by the organization.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253291, SV-253291r828957, SRG-OS-000095-GPOS-00049)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253291, SV-253291r828957, SRG-OS-000095-GPOS-00049
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:741
    Question:This is NA if the system does not have Bluetooth.

    Verify the Bluetooth radio is turned off unless approved by the organization. If it is not, this is a finding.

    Approval must be documented with the ISSO.

    References:
    CCI-000381
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253292 - Bluetooth must be turned off when not in use.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253292r828960_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000220
    Identities:CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: If not configured properly, Bluetooth may allow rogue devices to communicate with a system. If a rogue device is paired with a system, there is potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
    Fix Text:Turn off Bluetooth radios when not in use. Establish an organizational policy for the use of Bluetooth to include training of personnel.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471

    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:761

    V-253293 - The system must notify the user when a Bluetooth device attempts to connect.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253293r840170_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000230
    Identities:CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: If not configured properly, Bluetooth may allow rogue devices to communicate with a system. If a rogue device is paired with a system, there is potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
    Fix Text:Configure Bluetooth to notify users if devices attempt to connect.
    View Bluetooth Settings.
    Ensure "Alert me when a new Bluetooth device wants to connect" is checked.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: If not configured properly, Bluetooth may allow rogue devices to communicate with a system. If a rogue device is paired with a system, there is potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:781
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The system must notify the user when a Bluetooth device attempts to connect.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253293, SV-253293r840170, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253293, SV-253293r840170, SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:781
    Question:This is NA if the system does not have Bluetooth, or if Bluetooth is turned off per the organizations policy.

    Search for "Bluetooth".
    View Bluetooth Settings.
    Select "More Bluetooth Options"
    If "Alert me when a new Bluetooth device wants to connect" is not checked, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-000366
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253295 - Windows 11 nonpersistent VM sessions must not exceed 24 hours.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253295r890452_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-00-000250
    Identities:CCI-001199 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-28.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-28; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-28)
    Description: For virtual desktop implementations (VDIs) where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, the organization must enforce that sessions be terminated within 24 hours. This would ensure any data stored on the VM that is not encrypted or covered by Credential Guard is deleted.
    Fix Text:Set nonpersistent VM sessions to not exceed 24 hours.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: For virtual desktop implementations (VDIs) where the virtual desktop instance is deleted or refreshed upon logoff, the organization must enforce that sessions be terminated within 24 hours. This would ensure any data stored on the VM that is not encrypted or covered by Credential Guard is deleted.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:821
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:Windows 11 nonpersistent VM sessions must not exceed 24 hours.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253295, SV-253295r890452, SRG-OS-000185-GPOS-00079)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253295, SV-253295r890452, SRG-OS-000185-GPOS-00079
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:821
    Question:Verify there is a documented policy or procedure in place that nonpersistent VM sessions do not exceed 24 hours.

    If the system is NOT a nonpersistent VM, this is Not Applicable.

    For Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) implementations with no data at rest, this is Not Applicable.

    If there is no such documented policy or procedure in place, this is a finding.

    References:
    CCI-001199
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253323 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-253323r829053_rule
    Test Type:Manual
    Result:Not Checked
    Version:WN11-AU-000085
    Identities:CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Auditing object access for removable media records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> "Audit Removable Storage" with "Failure" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows 11
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows 11
    Identifier:5471
    Questionnaires: Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior. Auditing object access for removable media records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.
    Questionnaire ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:questionnaire:1381
    Result:NOT_TESTED
    Title:The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures.
    Test Actions:
    • NOT_TESTED (All child checks must be true.)
      • NOT_TESTED (CAT II, V-253323, SV-253323r829053, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219)
    Test Actions:
    Title:CAT II, V-253323, SV-253323r829053, SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219
    Test Action ID:ocil:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows11:testaction:1381
    Question:Security Option "Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings (Windows Vista or later) to override audit policy category settings" must be set to "Enabled" (WN11-SO-000030) for the detailed auditing subcategories to be effective.

    Use the AuditPol tool to review the current Audit Policy configuration:
    Open a Command Prompt with elevated privileges ("Run as Administrator").
    Enter "AuditPol /get /category:*"

    Compare the AuditPol settings with the following. If the system does not audit the following, this is a finding:

    Object Access >> Removable Storage - Failure

    Some virtual machines may generate excessive audit events for access to the virtual hard disk itself when this setting is enabled. This may be set to Not Configured in such cases and would not be a finding. This must be documented with the ISSO to include mitigations such as monitoring or restricting any actual removable storage connected to the VM.

    References:
    CCI-000172
    Result:NOT_TESTED

    V-253324 - The system must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes.
